name: Cassie Shannon
text: I called Andrew after seeing a sports doctor who recommended I use a boot for 6 weeks with little to no activity. I am SO thankful I called him and got a second opinion because I was back to my normal workouts in a few weeks and now I’m running better than I was before the injury and I feel like I have more knowledge and am able to listen to my body to know when to push and when to back off. Andrew will give you all the tools to be successful, you just have to listen, trust the process and do the work!

resp.text: Thanks for the wonderful review!!!

name: Charlene Robinson
text: I feel as if I will be repeating a lot of the reviews, but I have had a wonderful experience with Andrew Walker! I went to see him for a running injury six months after the injury started (and seeing another PT organization). He not only was thorough with answering questions, but was clearly interested in my issue and how best to treat for not only fast recovery but also prevention of re-injury in the future (both the injury I was dealing with and other potential injuries). I saw him maybe 5 times within a 5 month time span and got better and better each time. I appreciate how knowledgeable he is and how willing he is to share the research he has come across. I also liked how the exercises he prescribed built on each other, so I never felt unable to perform or uncomfortable with new exercises. I'm very happy with how well I've recovered and now I'm faster and more efficient as a runner as well!

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful words ❤️

name: Chrissy Frotten
text: I went in for a neck and shoulder issue that had been bothering me for months.  My first hour appointment fixed my issue about 90% of the way.  I went home with some new exercises.  I’m pretty sure as long as I do my homework assignments I won’t have to go back.  I am not looking forward to any future issues, but if I do I will definitely go back.

resp.text: Thanks you for the wonderful review!!!

name: James Patton
text:
Andrew is extremely knowledgeable, really cares about his patients, is always reading new research on PT, and wants to get you better in as few visits as possible.

There's nothing more you can ask for when you're using a PT to help return to your sport/activity.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review!

name: c wade
text: Andrew is highly knowledgeable and very intuitive in determining specific needs of clients.  I am so happy to still be running without neck and back pain following a car accident!  Andrew took time in really assessing my areas of pain and weakness, he gave me great exercises and therapy to help repair and improve my posture, movement and flexibility.  I can still hear his advice when I feel my gate, posture shift... 'trust your spine and don't over correct'... I'm still loving my sport and highly recommend this practice!

resp.text: Thanks!!! This review just popped up as they withheld them during the lockdown - thank you so much for the kind words :)

name: Carly Givens
text: Andrew is amazing and really listens when I go in if I have an issue. If you have any questions he will always answer them thoroughly. I am a runner and have benefitted greatly from seeing him.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review!!!

name: David Chadwick
text: Andrew was recommended to me by several members of the Huntsville running community when I experienced pain in my right heel this winter that severely impacted my running. Andrew examined my running style and leg strength and gave me a series of exercises that quickly helped reduce the pain and build back up my running. Andrew has a great knowledge of the latest research and targeted solutions for individual runners. Now I am running pain free and feel I have a better foundation for long term running fitness.

resp.text: Thanks for the review David! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and are very appreciative of your feedback.

name: Jacob Starace
text: It was an amazing experience that saved my senior season. I was finally able to compete injury free for the first season of my high school career and wouldn't be where I am right now in my athletic endeavors were it not for all of Andrew's help. Great guy that gives great results!

resp.text: Thanks Jacob! We’d like to thank you for your review! We try our best to provide quality care to our patients and are very appreciative of your feedback.

name: Matt Willauer
text: Andrew is amazingly gifted.  He has helped me with various issues stemming from a life-long issue.  I am now much better off than I have been in years and continue to work to strengthen myself under his care.  We have recommended several friends and all have been thrilled.  My family feels very fortunate to be able to work with Andrew and experience an improved quality of life.  Consider your research over.  Make an appointment, you will not regret it!

resp.text: Thanks Matt! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Teresa Fleischmann
text: Andrew is an extremely valuable asset to our community thanks to his passion for not only his patients, but for staying on top of current research and techniques. I have seen him numerous times and the care I have received is second to none. Andrew is also actively involved in our local athletic community offering injury prevention advice and training tips, and you can often see him volunteering his time at athletic events. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks Teresa! We appreciate the feedback!

name: Tonya Meier Hardy
text: Andrew is on top of the latest research and therapy practices! As a fitness instructor, being in good physical health is a job requirement. After an injury, Andrew worked to get me back up to speed quick! He takes time to address the physical as well as the mental aspects of recovery. Instead of needing to go for visits 3x per week, I saw him 3x over the course of a couple months and actually saved money. I appreciate the athlete log-in for videos so you can do them at home. Lastly, Andrew is an honest and dedicated professional. Would highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Tonya! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and are very appreciative of your feedback!

name: Mike Hubler
text: Andrew's knowledge of proper running techniques and his passion for injury prevention make him an invaluable resource for both casual and competitive athletes. I've enjoyed running for over 20 years, with no real training or coaching, and have taken a recent interest in mid-distance triathlons. With his advice, I am buying more effective shoes, improving my posture (all day - not just when running), adding helpful exercises outside of my run, and, of course, improving my run. His analysis is highly personalized and extremely thorough - it is so much more detailed and accurate than the several "free" tread mill videos in running stores that I've had over the years. Andrew is a leading health-care professional and we are lucky to have him in Huntsville. No matter what stage you are in with your exercise program, I can't recommend him highly enough.  -Ivy

resp.text: Ivy and Mike, thanks for the review! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Melissa Kelly
text: Andrew is super great! He keeps up with the latest research and uses it to better treat his patients. I came to him because I was having knee pain that kept me from running like I wanted to. He did a running analysis and identified some problem points. With the exercises her prescribed, I was able to get back to running (and was stronger), and I even completed a half marathon only a couple months after starting PT. Unlike traditional PT, I only had to go a few times over a couple months as opposed to several times per week, so it was much more convenient for my schedule as well. And Andrew is incredibly friendly, very responsive, and all around great to work with. I highly recommend him for any sports-related PT needs!!!

resp.text: Thanks Melissa! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and are very appreciative of your feedback :)

name: Laura Alexander
text: Another 5-star review for Andrew and PhysioWorks!  When I got to town, I had about 20% flexion in my left knee and constant pain and was afraid I was going to have to have surgery to fix it.  After a consultation with Andrew and a PT schedule, I am doing great!  No knee pain, up to past 90 degrees on flexion and CrossFitting 3+ times a week, as well as a regular yoga practice.  I can't thank Andrew enough for his thorough evaluation and spot on recommendations.  I'm not ready to hang up my shoes yet, and with Andrew's help, I'm feeling stronger than ever!

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review! We are excited to grow our five-star ratings!!!!

name: Richard Russell
text: I came to Andrew with a hamstring tear that had sidelined me from running and in pain before a planned business trip to India. Andrew was able to target in on the causes and provide me with some great tips on how to decrease my chances of injury while running. His advice about how much I can be working out while recovering was key to my improving so quickly. I definitely recommend him to any athlete!

resp.text: Thanks Rick! Education is a very important part of helping people get better and stay that way! Thanks for the feedback!

name: Amelias Whimsey
text: Andrew is a fantastic physical therapist, and I highly recommend him to everyone! I originally saw him for an impinged shoulder about 10 years ago in a traditional PT setting, and although I was very pleased with the results, the Physioworks practice model is a tremendous improvement over traditional PT. Andrew is able to provide more individual attention to his patients and work with them over a longer period of time to get better and more permanent results. Andrew has the gift of encouragement and focuses on educating his patients in the "why" of each exercise.

resp.text: Thanks Sandy! We appreciate your kind words!

name: Luke Hough
text: After limping my way through a 100km trail race and finally giving in to my bilateral Achilles tendinopathy, I went to Andrew for help. His well researched approach to therapy helped me progress from barely walking to increasing my running mileage so that I could make it to the start line of my goal 100mi race a little over 3 months later. Andrew's passion for sports therapy is obvious. His methods are based on the latest research in Orthopedics. You won't find a better PT in the area.

resp.text: Thanks Luke! We appreciate your kind words!

name: Ryan-Anna Wolfe
text: I highly recommend PhysioWorks. My condition was not an injury, but rather years of back pain, tension and fatigue, especially associated with pregnancy. I finally decided to try to tackle it, and Andrew was very thorough, knowledgeable, and helpful - giving me useful tips, techniques, and detailed stretches and exercises that quickly helped combat the pain and tension. Very thankful I gave him a try, and I recommend you to do the same!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Anna! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Jeb Williamson
text: As a non-competitive recreational runner I found the feedback and content of the Running Assessment and follow-up appointment  to be extremely helpful.  The exercises provided on the portal and the specific and practical recommendations regarding form tweaks have given me confidence that I can lessen the probability of injury going forward.  The Running Assessment and follow-up appointments are valuable and worth the investment of time and money.

resp.text: Thanks Jeb!

name: Lacey Tompkins
text: Andrew helped me heal from chronic ankle injuries and weakness by identifying root causes. The exercises he gave me to do at home really strengthened by ankle and made a huge difference with stability. Definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind comments and review!

name: Matthew Schachle
text: After a year of nagging chest and spinal pain that I had little hope of correcting I saw Andrew. One month later I am pain free. Thanks to Andrew's knowledge and instruction of my injuries, whats causing them and how to correct them, I'm back to moving like I used to in the gym and in life.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Matthew. We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and are very appreciative of your feedback.

name: greg musso
text: I recently visited Physioworks- Huntsville for a Running Assessment.  I was very pleased with the professionalism, knowledge, flexibility of scheduling, and pleasantness of Dr. Walker.  He initially did a thorough evaluation of my current exercise activity and my overall wellness.  Next, he assessed my range of mobility and strength.  Then he recorded a multi-angle video of my stride on a treadmill.  After conducting a thorough analysis of the video, he went over the video with me explaining every movement and motion, and what could be improved for efficiencies and injury prevention.  Last, he provided an exercise regimen that would strengthen muscles to assist in attaining the efficiencies and injury prevention cited through the video analysis.  I was glad that I finally scheduled to have this done, and feel lucky to have Dr. Walker's practice in our community. Thanks Dr. Walker!

resp.text: Greg, we really appreciate those kind words and feedback!

name: Tameron Harvell
text:
I had a knee injury that was about 2 years old by the time I saw Andrew. A combination of hoping it would get better on it's own and just not taking the time to get something done about (it was more annoying rather than debilitating) resulted in me putting off addressing it.

I was impressed with Andrew's assessment skills and his ability to explain the different compensations I had developed as a result of my injured knee. The exercises were challenging but doable and I really appreciated the videos he supplied so that I could check my form. He also offered to let me send him videos of me doing the exercises so that he could assess my form if I had questions.

The most positive aspect of my appointments with Andrew was how encouraging he was. I had all but stopped exercising for fear of aggravating the injury and, therefore, progressing to debilitating. Andrew has been very supportive of me returning to walking and even encouraging running if I wanted to do so. As I have started adding some running to my cardio, he has given very useful pointers on improving my form and speed in order to prevent injuries.

I will definitely seek out Andrew again in the future!

resp.text: Tameron, thank you for the review! This means so much to us!

name: Sarah green
text: Andrew took the time to explain my issues, provided the right exercises to address my issues, and followed up to make sure I was back to 100%. Happy to be 100% pain free again.

resp.text: 😁 Thanks for the wonderful review!

name: Travis Duehring
text: I have never been a runner.  I do not run races.  I took up running just six months ago to try and increase my exercise activity.  I travel a lot and running gave me a excuse to get out and explore the destinations I was traveling to.  As time went on and I started to add more consistent frequency and miles to my routine, I began to wonder if I was doing this "running thing" right.  I wanted to run to be healthy, but I was concerned at my age, with all the press out there on injuries, and with all of the marketed gear and training garb available to suckers like me... was I at risk?  PhysioWorks conducted a screening for me.  It was fabulous.  My status as a runner was not under review, my well being was.  The level of expertise, knowledge, and interest available to their clients is first rate.  Since my screening, I have conducted a full evaluation and scheduled a follow-up.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Travis!

name: Brandon Mader
text: Over the years I've received treatment from 8 different centers in the Huntsville/Madison area for running-related injuries.  While other centers were helpful in pain management, PhysioWorks was BY FAR the most helpful in finding the real cause of the problem.  They laid out a plan for me to get right.  Pretty great stuff.

resp.text: Thanks Brandon! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Troy Moyers
text: I spent some time with Andrew Walker yesterday for one of his free injury screenings and was impressed with his knowledge, thoroughness and common sense approach to helping runners be their best. If you have issues or would like professional advice to maximize your training, I highly recommend seeing him. It's always best to address issues before they turn into injuries, but wherever you are he can help you find what you need.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Troy!

name: Melissa Astin
text: I have been working with Andrew for a few months and have had a lot of relief from lower back pain due to a powerlifting injury. He is very professional and patient to explain everything I had questions about. I highly recommend PhysioWorks to anyone seeking a solution to their needs. With Andrew's help I have managed to avoid back surgery and gained confidence to get back in the weight room and lift properly and safely!

resp.text: Thanks for the review! Love to hear you are getting back to the things you love! 😊

name: Polly West
text:
I saw Andrew in January for a running assessment after having gotten back into running a couple months before. I had back surgery in 2009 (L5-S1 discectomy) and was strongly discouraged from running by a PT I saw after my surgery.  I had been feeling pretty good getting back into it, but was worried about possible injury both to my back and knees.  Andrew's running assessment and subsequent muscle strength assessment were extremely helpful.  He gave me a couple of things to change while running to help prevent injury and a list of stretches to strengthen my leg and core muscles.  A few weeks ago I ran my very first half marathon.  A few weeks before that, I had tweaked my back doing something stupid and was afraid I was going to have to give up running the half.  I emailed Andrew who encouraged me that all was not lost.  With his expert advice, I not only ran the whole way, but ran faster than I was expecting!  I have since run a 10K and have 2 more half marathons and a 10-miler on the horizon.

Seriously, make an appointment with Andrew!  For anything!  Not just if you're a runner or athlete.  He can help with normal (and not so normal) life pains, post-surgery issues, etc.  Not only is he knowledgeable about how the body works, but he also takes the time to explain the whats and whys and hows.  My only complaint is that he lives in Alabama while I'm in Colorado and therefore I can't very easily make appointments with him!  So all of you North-Alabamians, take advantage of how close he is to you and let him help you!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Polly! Really appreciate the kind comments :)

name: Whitney Walker
text: Andrew Walker is wonderful at what he does and takes the time you need to listen to your complaints and get right to the root of the problem. He is able to spend more one-on-one time with you than other physical therapists at larger groups, who you don't see every time and are very limited in what they can do.  I will also say that he does take his work home, not literally, but because he does care about each one of his patients. It's nice to have someone in the health field that has this burden for helping others. I would highly recommend him and this is coming from someone who has already been to 3 other groups of therapists.

resp.text: Thanks for the encouragement Whitney! We aim to provide our patients with a high level of care using the latest research and technology!

name: Wendy Tyler
text: I went to see Andrew last year for a running assessment.  The information provided as well as the exercises he recommended were helpful and beneficial in helping me keep away the dreaded IT band pain.  Andrew is patient when explaining the issues as well as the goals of the exercises.  He is an active and caring provider who is always concerned and caring about the progress that I was making.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Wendy!

name: Todd DeWitte
text: I have been working out for 30 years and have played sports on different levels for longer. PhysioWorks has brought insight and understanding to many of the body's movements that I didn't have. I would consider myself a relative novice when it comes to running but Andrew seems to be able to explain complex concepts in a way that I can apply and get results. I wish that I had this reference and teaching at an earlier age when I played sports competitively. My development would have progressed much further.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Todd!!

name: Shelby Agnew
text: If you are looking for a physical therapist that is patient, knowledgeable, and will get you back to where you want to be, there is no better place in town than Physioworks. From the beginning, Andrew Walker is an empathetic and detailed listener, which enables him to tailor his approach to each individual athlete. He works incredibly hard to make sure all of his approaches are completely evidence-based. He has even contacted research scientists to ask about therapies under study in order to find out if they would be beneficial for a specific patient. Andrew is willing to think outside of the box and has had a dogged persistence to helping me heal and get back to the things I love to do. I have recommended every injured friend in Huntsville to him and will continue to do so. His practice model has made a few friends hesitant because he is “out-of-network,” but I will add to the many people who have already said that by doing my exercises at home and being seen less often, I have saved hundreds of dollars in health care costs as compared to a traditional, in-network physical therapist.

resp.text: Thanks Shelby! We really appreciate the kind words and feedback.

name: Ken Davis
text: Went to see Andrew after about 2 months of PT for recovery of a back hamstring injury which was preventing me from running.  He did evaluate  my running form, made several suggestions and gave me a suite of exercises to help strengthen possible problem areas. Now after about 4-5 months of following this regimen I am back running and will be able to run a half marathon this year which was my big goal. Thanks Andrew

resp.text: Thanks for the review Ken! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Kathy Martin
text: My recovery is going GREAT thanks to Andrew at PhysioWorks! Exercises that make sense and appointments that are convenient and very beneficial to recovery. I definitely recommend him!!!

resp.text: Hey Kathy! Thanks for the kind review!

name: Laura Perry
text: After suffering a stress fracture a couple of years ago, I had recurring knee and ankle pain related to running. I tried working with another physical therapy group and ended up frustrated when they could only work on the specific site of the pain and not work to correct the gait problems that were causing the pain. I met Andrew earlier this year and spoke with him at several races, but I put off scheduling a running assessment because I was afraid he wouldn't be able to help any more than the other PT group. I finally decided to schedule a running assessment after seeing my friends dramatically improve their running. It was the best thing I could have done! Andrew did a full strength and flexibility analysis along with the video running analysis. He assigned very specific strengthening and stretching exercises. Andrew was great about answering questions via email between appointments. He also worked directly with my running coach when I had specific problems. I loved that the appointments were spread out enough to see significant changes with each visit. It was also helpful to see the improvements on video at each session. My strength has definitely improved. I don't have residual soreness after runs. Best of all, after just two months I've come close to my best pre-injury 5k time and I'm enjoying running again.

resp.text: Laura, thanks for the review! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Jeremy Belcher
text: Went to see Andrew after getting to a stalling point from ACL recovery. He gave me some specific exercises and stretches to move recovery forward. The exercises are accessed via a website ‘portal’, which is nice as you can reprint them if you misplace them and even print an adherence tracker to keep up with your reps/sets progress. If you get to where an exercise is too easy, Andrew can substitute a new one via the portal so you can keep progressing without needing to go in to visit. Questions about exercises between visits are answered promptly. I’ve finally started noticing some marked improvements in leg strength since starting.

resp.text: That is awesome Jeremy! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: G.W. Boon
text: As a professional athlete I understand that your body is an investment, and you have to protect that investment. As a result of three knee surgeries and an Achilles repair, I had several imbalance issues as well as knee pain when I competed on the basketball court. I saw Andrew at Physio Works and received excellent care. He was able to assess my body's imbalances using innovative diagnostic techniques, and he created a program that has lead me to see significant improvement. There are many physical therapists in the Huntsville area, but with the diagnostic tools and video analysis at Physio Works I believe the care they provide, especially for athletes, is second to none. I don't know of anyone else doing this type of work. I was very pleased with my experience, and I recommend Physio Works to any athlete, amateur or professional, who is serious about becoming and staying injury-free.

resp.text:
Thanks, G.W! We appreciate the feedback!

Andrew

name: Maureen Angotta
text: Starting running at a later age I knew it would not be easy and after a lot injuries that always involved one side I knew I needed something more than PT after the injury. My last injury in 2015 took 5 months of PT and I knew I still had lingering issues that needed work after being released from care. Andrew's assessment identified those areas that were too strong (compensating for the weaknesses) and the ones that needed re-training to engage as they should.  The care Andrew has provided has made me a balanced and stronger runner. I can see a difference in posture, walking, and running. I highly recommend Andrew.

resp.text: Maureen, thank you for the review and kind words!

name: Stephen McNair
text: I saw Andrew Walker a couple months ago for the 1.5 hour running assessment. My experience was great. He helped me determine the main reason I was having shin splints when I go running. I've since corrected my running mechanics and my pain level has been greatly reduced. He even spent more time with me than was allotted. His communication follow ups and answering my questions via email was also really good.

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback Stephen! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Ali Meeks
text: I found Andrew to be a terrific physical therapist, not only during therapy, but before and after. He is one of the few PTs out there that works hard outside his patient time to stay current on biomechanical research and actually USES it in his therapies. Because he keeps his thumb on the pulse of what is new and happening, you can be sure that you are getting the most up to date help possible. He follows up with you to ensure that your therapy is going well, and really wants to see you succeed. His technical background is second to none, and his digital technologies for receiving your therapy plans, scheduling, and payment are easy as pie to use in your busy life. Thanks Andrew!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind comments Ali!

name: Cameron McWilliams
text: Dr. Walker, an incredibly knowledgeable and understanding physical therapist, has set the bar high when it comes to my expectations of the quality of medical care. He puts forth the effort to stay sharp by reading all of the current research publication material, and he has many quality connections for other medical services. His business model is very economical as you seem him once every month or two and are trusted to perform the exercises at home, although he is always available for advice over email. Further, he is listens attentively to your problems and does not come across as condescending - even if you make errors in following his advice. He works to get the abnormality under control and then push it to strengthen as much as possible without flaring up it to eventually handle normal activities. I had a nagging hip pain, which he identified as a compressive hamstring tendonopathy from cycling and sitting for long hours on hard lecture hall seats. He addressed the problem by having my sit off of the tendon and on a cushion as much as possible and then progress to strengthening. We overcame the problem in about 2 months. I have also been seeing him about a shoulder injury, which has progressed rather non linearly for about 8 months now. This timeline hasn't been very ideal for me returning to exercise, but I am confident it is in good hands for recovery and will keep the review updated accordingly.

resp.text: Thanks Cameron! We appreciate your kind words! It is our goal to provide the highest level of care!

name: Amy Williams
text: I first went to see Andrew Walker at PhysioWorks a couple months ago for a severe shin splint. I had just finished physical therapy elsewhere and didn't get anywhere with my healing. It was a waste of time and money. A friend then recommended going to PhysioWorks and told me how different Andrew is from all other physical therapists. After doing the running analysis, Andrew was able to determine the cause of my shin splint and saw many weak areas with my running form and mechanics. He created a personalized exercise program to strengthen those areas during the time that my shin was healing. I love how he just doesn't focus on the injury and then send you on your way. He has done so much for me and is always available when you have questions. I am already feeling like a much stronger runner than I ever was before, thanks to him. He is the best physical therapist and I would recommend him in a heartbeat!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Amy!

name: rich shelton
text: Mr.andrew is very intiligent and dedicated to his approach to pt. He is by far the best physical therapist in Huntsville so in my opinion. Very new age way of thinking and truly dedicated to getting you better.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We try to provide tailored rehab to people in a wide variety of sports using the latest rehab! Thank you for such kind comments!

name: John Harfouch
text: I was struggling with hip problems for months. I run maybe 20-30 miles a week but when I made my first appointment with Andrew my hip pain was so bad I could barely walk. I had gone to another in-network provider and he had told my there was a problem with my psoas. That treatment did nothing even though I saw him 2x/week. I've been to Andrew 4x in 5 months and each time he observes me and then prescribes new exercises for me to do at home. The meetings are over an hour and he is very patient and engaged. It is not like any pt I have been to in the past. Most of the work you do at home, so there are not a lot of appointments. I've been doing my exercises regularly and my pain has receded and I'm back to running. Andrew not only correctly diagnosed the problem, he takes the time to explain exactly what is going on. I've worked on my running form and with my exercises, I'm a better, faster, more efficient runner than before I got injured. With BCBS, I sent the claim in and was reimbursed, so don't be scared off by the out of network label. I highly recommend this guy. He knows what he's doing.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words John. Our goal is to provide high quality and cost-effective care. We are thankful for you kind comments :)

name: Julie Mason
text: I recommend Andrew for runners because he is passionate about running biomechanics and helping runners achieve good form/technique. He is always teaching me something new and answers all of my questions.

resp.text: Thanks for the review and recommendation Julie!

name: mcyogi
text: PhysioWorks and Andrew Walker came highly recommended from my boss after he had been seeing me deal with a muscle strain in my back for over a month.  Andrew was able to help me identify exercises that would help work out the troubled area.  I think I spent much less time going to therapy because we both recognized I could do the stretches necessary on my own once they were identified.  PhysioWorks is out-of-network, so I was responsible for filing with insurance, but Blue Cross Blue Shield of Alabama covered $116 of my two visits that had totaled $135.  That left me paying less than a copay would have been AND I was away from work much less time than if he wanted me to keep coming in and doing the exercises on site.  He added more exercises with each visit.  I would definitely return to him if I had need again.

resp.text: Thanks for the review!

name: Karen Paulukaitis
text: Having suffered a hip injury this spring, a friend kept telling me I needed to go see Andrew at PhysioWorks. I did and the progress I have made is incredible. The gait analysis revealed I had some issues with my running. With Andrew's help, my hip issue has been resolved and I am working on changing my running style. For the first time in several years I am running with little to no pain. This has allowed me to work on my running and I had my best 10K time for an Olympic distance triathlon within 2 months of my first appointment at PhysioWorks.

resp.text: Karen, thanks for the great review!

name: Katrin Smith
text: I highly recommend Andrew PT at PhysioWorks for any injury or prevention of injury.  His approach is very individualized and specific with lots of feedback over email, fb messenger and texting.  I struggled for years with an ongoing hip issue and it got to a point were it interfered not just with sports, but also with my work and daily living. I followed his blogs on social media and finally contacted him in December of 2017.  I am so glad I did!  He responded almost immediately and as soon as I had a referral I was good to go. He assessed my strength and abilities and identified multiple problems.  He methodically works on one issue at the time and helps me build my hip strengths up.  Instead of going 3 days a week for several weeks (which is really hard to do if you are working), I was set up over a longer period of time (once a week, then twice a month, then 4 weeks/6 weeks later).  The phone exercise app he provides, allows me to track the exercises I have to do.  He is very encouraging especially at times when I think I'm not making any progress and teaches you self release methods to relieve pain.  I am now into my 4th month of therapy  (6th visit) and I'm running again!  My hip feels stronger and I'm looking forward to many more miles on trails and roads in the future.  Andrews approach does take self motivation because you have to do the work on your own rather than at office setting for an hour 3 days a week.  But being pain free is a great motivator.  So if doctors visits haven't worked out for you, I would highly recommend you contact Andrew.  He is a great asset to our community!

resp.text: Thanks Sandy! We appreciate your kind words! It is our goal to provide the highest level of care!

name: Susi Bowermaster
text:
I loved every second I got to work with PhysioWorks! It was an experience like any other. I felt valued and heard and I didn't feel like another number.
The video analysis was awesome to watch! I learned a great deal about my running and how I can improve. I enjoyed my time with PhysioWorks and am thankful for the improvements I was able to see with them when I didn't see any with other doctors. I got my life back! Thanks for all you did!

resp.text: Thanks for our first review! We try our best to provide quality care utilizing the latest evidence and technology to help our patients and your feedback is so helpful to us!

name: Tag Choate
text:
Huge shoutout to Andrew at PhysioWorks, Sports and Wellness, Inc. for making my Spartan Trifecta possible.
After several months of tendon pain in my knee, my leg ultimately gave way during a Saturday morning long run last December.  I had bought my Trifecta Pass just a few weeks prior after assuring myself that I would recover in time to race.  After weeks of ineffective self care I went to my family doctor. After an X-ray and no real good advice they referred me to an orthopedic doctor. He confirmed I didn’t have anything major and gave me the same useless advice and a prescription ointment that didn’t do much. By this time it was all I could do to walk around the house. I was heartbroken to think that I wouldn’t be able to race. Thankfully I found Andrew through his insightful Facebook posts and gave him a call last January. His wholistic and long term vision for getting better and staying better was exactly what I was looking for. The running analysis he provided revealed so many things that could have stalled my fitness goals indefinitely had they been left unaddressed.  I travel a lot for work as well, so his “work on your own” method for physical therapy exercises rather than multiple visits per week was a perfect way for me to augment my existing exercise routine without disrupting my work schedule. By March I was able to finish the Atlanta Sprint race - still walking more than I wanted but at least I was on the course and it only took about 30 minutes more than usual.  After about 5 or 6 visits I had made good progress and was on my way to pain free running. By July I was able to run the Asheville Super and only had to pace myself a bit on the downhill portion towards the end of the race.  In August I started having shin splints.  I reached out to Andrew via Facebook Messenger and within an hour had a new set of exercises that took care of the problem in a few weeks.  No “make an appointment with the receptionist” or other nonsense like that.  The last time I had shin splints they lingered for months and the only advice I got from my doctor was to take a few Advil every day and stop exercising - not an option for me. Now in November I was able to run the Carolina Beast without any pain.  Achieving this goal would not have happened without Andrew’s help and seemed impossible when I was limping out of the store with a knee brace last December.
At first I was worried about not being able to have insurance cover my therapy. In retrospect, the investment I made with PhysioWorks is going to save me so much money in the long run.  Andrew’s approach was exactly what this Spartan needed to finally join the Trifecta Tribe.  If you’re an Obstacle Course Racer and have any pain that’s keeping you off the course, I highly recommend you give PhysioWorks a try. Andrew works with a local Crossfit business as well, so he can help with more than just running.
Thanks Andrew!

resp.text: Thanks Tag! We appreciate your kind words! It is our goal to provide the highest level of care!

name: Kenny Anton
text: After months of wanting to do a running assessment but not being able to afford it, my father paid for my appointment. I saw Andrew at Physioworks about a month ago now. I'm a non-formally trained regular runner with several halves and one full marathon, so far, under my belt. Previous to going to Physioworks I had suffered from regular occurring achilles tendinopathy and strains to my gastrocnemious muscle. Andrew was able to shed light on several corrections I could make to improve my form and methods. After roughly 30 minutes of range of motion and strength testing, I got on the treadmill for a running assessment. Andrew showed me several things about my stride that I could improve; everything from how my feet were falling to how my torso was positioned while running. After the appointment Andrew gave me several strengthening exercises for my weak muscle groups and left me with some invaluable tools advice to improve both my time and endurance. I am so thankful for the opportunity to have had this done. Thank you Andrew for what you do for the running community of Huntsville!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Kenny!

text: I love Dr Lemaks office and his staff, many have been with him for years so its always comforting when a friendly face is there to greet you. Dr Lemak always talks your options through with you so you can make an informed decision when choosing your treatment options. Wouldnt go anywhere else for my Orthopedic needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Stacie Painter
text: I went for my knee sent me for an MRI said it didn't show any thing wants me to do rehab but rehab is not going to help with the grinding in my knee and on top of that the MRI coat my $600 and it was no help

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 205-971-3348 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Bonnie Glover
text: I’d like to commend Dr. David Lemak and his crew for an awesome job. His assistant Jamie is awesome as well he comes in, asked questions talks to me about what’s going on , Dr. Lemak comes in behind him and asked his question , sometimes different but they are awesome people very attentive  and get down to brass tack of what’s going on and how to attack the problem head on . They discuss things on how you may have hurt something , how it can be fixed , how to prevent it . They are just all around super Dr.David Lemak and staff.

text:
Dr. Lemak is a great doctor/surgeon. He did a great job on my knee replacement. I would encourage anyone to see him if you have orthopedic issues. He is friendly and put up with all my questions and concerns.
I appreciate him doing everything he could to make my knee replacement outcome the best possible. Thanks.

name: Mary Dunn
text: Dr Lemak, is a great doctor and surgeon, would recommend him to anyone

resp.text: We are so happy to read such a great review about David Lemak, MD!  Your recommendation means so much to us.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your comment. Have a great day!

name: Roger Hayes
text: Had a great experience at my initial consultation! Very kind and talkative!

resp.text: We strive to provide great experiences. Thank you for your feedback!

name: Gene Walker
text: Short waiting time. Staff and Dr Lemak were extremely friendly and very helpful in answering my questions and concerns.

name: Wood Family
text:
I have been a patient of David Lemak for several years. His dad did my hip replacement and David did a revision in 2011. He did the scope on my knee in 2016 and he did my knee replacement in September. I was a firefighter paramedic for 32 years and he kept  me on the job and during my last several years. II can’t say enough good things about Dr. Lemak. He is my choice and I could not ask for better results from each time he has treated me. I am getting a little older now and I have to slow down a little but I am glad that this guy knows what he is doing. He has proved trustworthy.
He did not pay me to say any of the above. Thank you David.   Perry Wood.

resp.text: Mr. Wood -  we are so happy to read this great review!  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  We will pass your kind words along to Dr. Lemak.   Hope you have a wonderful weekend!

name: Jacqueline Lund
text: Dr. Lemak is wonderful! He is very personable and has a great bedside manner! His office staff is friendly and efficient! Great experience overall!

resp.text: Jacqueline Lund, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Lemak and his team!

name: TheGetthenet
text: Painless recovery

resp.text: We really appreciate your feedback!

name: LaTonya Willis
text: I've had a good experience with Dr. Lemak's office. Mrs. Janet has gone above and beyond to assist with any questions and concerns I've had since my surgery on July 31st. I would most definitely recommend Dr. Lemak for anyone suffering Orthopedic injuries....⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

resp.text: Latonya Willis, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review! Your recommendation means so much to us and we're happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience. Have a great day!

text: Dr. David Lemak is always patient and spends time explaining everything in detail. Wouldn't think of going to anyone else.

resp.text: Norma Phillips, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Rocky Redding
text: My wife's knee still hurts a year later and he waited too long on sending her to a wound doctor and now has a permanent large hole and scar. She spent one month at Grandview Hospital which I would not recommend!!!!

resp.text: Mr. Redding - we appreciate your review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. Please reach out to us at (205) 971-7103 when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

name: Ricky Melton
text: Dr.Lemak, Lindsay and rge entire staff , especially front office, is the best of the best!  Thank you for helping me get through the toughest 3 years if my life.  You are simply the best,

resp.text: Ricky Melton, thank you for the star rating! We always strive to provide top quality service and are pleased to hear that your experience with Dr. Lemak and his staff was a good one! Thank you again for letting our team know how we did! We look forward to helping again if you need us in the future. Take care!

name: Cocoa Young
text:
Dr.David Lemak and the Entire Staff is WONDERFULLY EXCELLENT!!!!
THANK YOU FOR REPAIRING MY ROTATOR CUFF!!! BEST WISHES TO ALL

name: Alberta Knight
text: They are the BEST!!!!

resp.text: Patient satisfaction is our top priority! Thank you for the star rating.

name: Whit Allen
text: Dr. David Lemak is a gentleman and a scholar!  But a successful doctor's office takes more than a father with a good reputation and being a great doctor.  Dr. Lemak's staff ties it all together.  Like every doctor's office, their busy.  Allow 24 hours and they will be back with you before that time frame and meet your request if within reason.  I feel like Dr. Lemak knows and wants whats best for me, but is allowing me to make the decision to when it's time for surgery.  I am not a professional athlete, just a guy wanting to walk right.  But I feel I get treated equivalent in his office.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments.

name: Helen Sturgeon
text: Dr.  David Lemak is the best of the best and stands out among the rest. He does not make you feel rushed in an appointment. He carefully explained my situation, the surgery and what is ahead of me in terms I could understand.  He listened to all my questions and concerns and answered them to my complete satisfaction. The day after surgery when he came to visit me he explained he was going out of the country for a week and he gave me his cell number in case I needed him. How very impressive! Other physicians would have told me to call their associate if I needed anything or had any concerns. I have never had a physician that I have felt so comfortable with and that I feel has a genuine concern for my well being. My injury and surgery was very serious. I actually left Cullman Hospital Emergency Room after being there seven hours on Friday with this injury and went home with a severely broken leg and in a lot of pain until I could get to Dr. Lemak the following Monday for surgery due to Dr. Lemak's highly recommended reputation.  I knew I was making the right decision and it was worth waiting for him to be my physician for this injury and surgery. I will always highly recommend Dr. David Lemak  when given the opportunity to do so.

name: Stevie Phillips
text: All good

resp.text: Stevie Phillips, thank you for sharing your positive experience! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: gerkin rhodes
text: Dr. David Lemak,,,,,,,,,,IS THE BEST!!!♥️

name: BJ MOODY
text: I can not say enough great things about Dr. Justin Fogo, and his Staff!!! Mrs. Meghan at the front is a dream come true, she treats you like family, and so does the Doc!!! I was in Severe pain when I came in and with in hours after seeing Dr. Justin, it had eased away. He was very through, and done X-rays to make sure what he was dealing with!  I’m going twice a week now, using the traction machine, among other things, and love it!!! I feel GREAT!!! Thank you Dr. Justin Fogo!!!! I definitely would recommend him to ANY & ALL!!!! Don’t waste your time ANY WHERE ELSE!!!!

name: John Theabolt
text: Such a nice guy and so talented, very good communication about what my issues are and how he can help correct them!

name: Pure Bliss
text: By far, one of the best Chiropractors I've been to. Great staff.

name: Ryan Jones
text: This was the best chiropractic experience I have had in a long time. I typically have always gone to Lakeshore or Cahaba for my chiropractic needs, however, I thought I would try out the local place and I was NOT disappointed! I will definitely go back and would recommend Chelsea Chiropractic to all my friends and family!

name: Amanda Larson
text: Dr. Fogo is amazing.  He really takes the time to get to know his patients and why they are there.  I would refer anyone to him.  Price is extremely reasonable as well.

name: Scott Robicheaux
text: He's very good.

name: Cathie Bella
text: Best chiropractor in the Birmingham Area!

name: Shea Watkins
text: Improves my health and they are very flexible with scheduling

name: Marilyn Hubbard
text:
I came in to get prepared for knee surgery by getting strength in leg muscles. Erin did a great job evaluating what I needed to work on the most. She really loaded me up on exercises at the clinic but also ones to do at home to strengthen my muscles.
These were tough exercises to do considering that I’m 75 years old but she made it very enjoyable even though it hurt. 😬 I will definitely be going back to see her after my surgery. I know that all of this pre-surgical strengthening is going to help me heal much quicker.
I would definitely recommend going to CSM for any type of rehab

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. We aim to make your road to recovery as enjoyable and efficient as possible. We're glad to hear that we succeeded! We wish you all the best.

name: Darla McMullen
text:
I've been to several physical therapy companies in the Pelham/Alabaster area and CSM is by far the best. The others certainly had very caring, knowledgeable people, but were dealing with too many clients at once to give individual care.
I definitely recommend CMS!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and entrusting your care to us. During this time, we are working harder than ever to continue providing the care you need while keeping you and our staff safe. We are happy to be here for you.

name: Lynne Hanson
text: Champion sports medicine is a great place. Brad makes you feel like you are his only patient. I have made great strides in my rehab already after only three visits. They make scheduling your appointments easy and send reminders to help you be on time. If you are in need of physical therapy, Champion and Brad are a great choice!

name: Mike Derzis
text: I love Champion Sports Medicine, and highly recommend them if you have to have physical therapy. I have had both knee replacement surgeries in the past nine months. I chose Champion for my second knee and really saw the difference in the workouts and undivided attention I received from Jarrod. My left knee rehabbed much quicker and better than my right knee. I chose to go back to a Champion for a tendinitis problem. So far see great results! Thanks Champion and Jarrod Robbins!

resp.text: We really appreciate you taking the time to leave such a positive review. We are so glad that you had a wonderful experience at Champion sports Medicine. Our team’s priority is to give personal and attentive care to each patient. We are thrilled to hear that they made your time with us enjoyable and beneficial.

name: Chris Weeden
text:
I started seeing Chelsea after a dairy related injury suffered in June of 2019. My treatment plan, which was more or less a form of extreme yoga, was incredibly effective at lowering my current pain level and preventing future discomfort. I saw results immediately after the first appointment. The results were also noticeable to my friends and family. I was bitchin’ less and generally happier because the pain had disappeared. Chelsea and the team at Champion Sports Medicine would be my preferred care providers for any subsequent injuries.

-Christopher “Yardsale” Weeden

resp.text: Thank you for your glowing recommendation. We always strive to provide our patients with exceptional and compassionate care. We hope that each new day brings you closer to a full recovery!

name: Karen Maercker
text: I have been very pleased by the quality of care I have received from my physical therapist, Chelsea V., and Champion Sports Medicine at the Pelham location.

resp.text: Our team always strives to offer the best service and we're glad to know we were a part of your recovery process. We appreciate the review and we wish you a speedy recovery!

name: Jeannie Evans
text: With an objective of returning to participating in a variety of sports, I am offered a therapy program designed to accomplish this objective ASAP by knowing what to do and what not to do. Therapy is explained in detail with a personalized program with videos to be viewed by internet. A very  professional and effective program is provided.

name: Maria Luckey
text: Staff is awesome! Friendly and provide great customer service.  Love how they work your plan to regain mobility,strength and health back.

name: Phillip Leon
text: I have been coming to C.S.M. for four weeks. Brad and the staff are excellent. They stay with you while you're working out and will let you know if you need to adjust your stance in any way. You are pushed to your limits to get the most out of therapy. I couldn't ask for a better therapy team.

name: Jay Murray
text: This place is amazing! The staff goes above and beyond and they treat you as a person, not a patient. If I ever need PT again, this is where I'm going!

name: Lynn Phillips
text: Our daughter has received excellent care here for her knee pain. All of the staff is very knowledgeable, and have been super friendly and helpful.

name: Rita Darden
text: Great experience at Champion Sports Medicine, Calera, AL.  Nate was patient and very kind, although worked my injury extremely well.  I recovered sooner than my orthopedic doctor had estimated which I believe was due to the excellent therapy I received.

name: Will H
text: Great and patient people. Always willing to help and counsel you on the right treatment for you.

name: Mike C
text: Great staff and the programs are not cookie cutter but geared to your specific needs. Would highly recommend them for your physical therapy needs!

name: Jack Hartsfield
text: They are very nice and knowledgeable,  hopefully my son will have a full recovery soon!!

name: dg murph
text: Professional Group. Accessed throughly my issue and had a plan that worked.Dedicated and Communicated thru process.

name: Sally Evenden
text: Customized individual treatment that is much appreciated

name: JP
text: I wish I could give Dr. Daigre 10 stars!! Fantastic doctor who cares about his patients.  Bed side manners are great. Decatur is lucky to have a surgeon like him!

name: Alison Cornelius
text: Dr. Daigre did surgery on my foot.  He is an amazing doctor who is very kind and patient.  He answered all of my questions and concerns.  I drive an hour one way to see him.  My favorite thing is that he prayed with me before surgery.

name: Lis D Brden
text: Foot and Ankle surgery is scheduled.

name: Jessica Daigre
text: Dr. Daigre is an amazing physician. He is knowledgeable and professional and he truly cares about his patients. I would recommend him to anyone!

name: Michael Sweaza
text: Dr.D fixed my wife ankle. It was shredded. He did a awesome job. The only issue I have is he. Gave my wife lectures about how to live her life. He was more concerned with her life style then controlling her pain and he wanted to detox her while she was in s incredible amount of pain. Look our lifestyle doesn't affect anyone but us. He isn't a addiction specialist . We paid him to fix her ankle.

name: Debbie Lowery
text: Dr. Daigre is an excellent Dr. and surgeon, did surgery on my left foot and he will do my right foot in a few months..I wouldn't even consider anyone else... He is knowledgable..kind and a class act, in all respects.. Thank You Dr.Daigre!

name: Bobby Brady
text:
My father saw Dr. Daigre for severe wrist pain. X-rays we're taken and the Dr. Diagnosed my father with arthritis. My father went to another Dr. Today and showed my father the bones were all out of place inihis wristwand his tendons are probably torn pretty badly.
It's a shame two Doctors can have two completely different diagnosis. Do your research!

name: Greg Baxley
text: Although being a previous patient here my wife was told she had to have a doctor's referral to be seen again for a new injury which meant she had to wait to see a regular doctor so he could say she needs to see an orthopedic Dr asap. Paperwork was sent to this clinic on Thurs and when we called on Tuesday to see why we haven't gotten an appointment yet we were told "it hasn't been processed yet" now she has to wait almost a month for the "first available" appointment. And to top it off she was told she didn't need a referral after all! And this office can't call you if they have a cancellation, you have to call them daily if you want to have a chance to be seen faster

name: Karl GOULET
text: I had both my wrist done back to work in six weeks. He did a great job on me. My wife had Corporal tunnel to in her right hand a few years ago. She’s been great after he worked on her. No scar on my wife and mine are about gone

name: Carmie Carr
text:
Extremely rude front desk. I had a $25 copay. The appointment was for my husband. Since I had medicare and another supplemental I have never had to pay a copay.
I did not bring the correct credit card and the young girl at the desk said Dr. Ikard Jr would not see him unless we paid the $25 right then.
I told her I could call it in and she said I would need to reschedule if I did not have the $25 that day.
I feel any doctor who puts a value on a patient is not the kind if doctor I want to put my husbands care in.
If refusing a patient for $25 is our “new” new, then I’ll go somewhere else where my husband is worth more than $25 .
UOC is where money is far more important than a patients care.
They would have gotten their money if the front desk girl was more professional and would listen to me but we were blown off by her.
Thus my 1 star rating. If I could give a negative I would. Staff should show more understanding

name: Aaron Cano
text: Staff is not helpful and incompetent.... there is such a lack of communication and knowledge at the front desk. I was in Biloxi, Mississippi early that day. I called the office at 9:50am and asked if I get to the office 15 minutes late, could I still be seen. The receptionist said, “Yes, as long as it’s within 30 minutes of your scheduled appointment”. I knew that I can make my 3 hour and 50 minute drive in time to get there with 15 minutes to spare so I made the drive to Tuscaloosa. When I was 20 minutes from the office I called to ensure I can be seen and the same receptionist said no the doctor cannot see me. She completely contradicted her original statement and wasted a full 8 hours of driving and gas with no consideration to my particular situation. I will never recommend an office with an incompetent front desk staff and lack of care that I made a distant drive under unforeseen circumstances. If only they had the integrity to follow the original statement provided to me may I have had a totally different experience.

name: Teresa Atchenson
text: I WAS A PATIENT OF DR.JOHN P.BUCKLEY SINCE 1985.I LAST SAW THIS WONDERFUL MAN AND DOCTOR  IN FEB.OF 2017.THE NEXT FEB.I WAS TOLD HE RETIRED PREVIOUS DEC..I CRIED LIKE A BABY.HE WAS A DOCTOR THAT WAS CALM GOOD SPITIT,ALWAYS TOOK TIME TO ANSWER MY QUESTIONS.HE PASSED AWAY EARLY OF 2020.ONLY 2 YRS.OF RETIREMENT.IT BROKE MY HEART.LAST TIME I WAS AT UOC.WAS THE LAST TIME.I HAVENT SET A FOOT IN THERE SINCE DR.BUCKLEY PASSED.I TRIED TO GET AN APPT SINCE,BUT WAS TOLD SINCE MY DOCTOR RETIRED,I WOULD HAVE TO BE TREATED AS A NEW PATIENT.I TOLD THEM NO WAY.I WAS A PATIENT FROM 1985 - 2017.DR.BUCKLEY  ALL THOSE YEARS.THEY WANTED HIM OUT I WAS TOLD LAST TIME I WAS THERE NY A NURSE.THEY SAID HE TOOK UP TOO MUCH TIME WITH PATIENTS.HE WAS ONE OE DOCTORS THAT STARTED UOC IN 1974.THEY SHOULD BE ASHAMED.RIP DR.BUCKLEY.LOVE YOU❤.its true about rude staff too.

name: Latasha Hooper
text: Staff is very rude. I’ve called 6 times to schedule an appointment. Female that answers the phone catches an attitude very quickly.

name: Scott Shuttleworth
text: DO NOT USE THIS CLINIC!  Doctors may be good but the staff getting to them does not tell the truth and then cops attitude...I called a week before and specifically asked about them taking my insurance...they said yes the did...I specifically asked if they were network and they said yes...I made the appt and showed up after a 1.5 hour drive. Signed in, waited and they said they didn't have a referral from my doc...when they told me the week before they did...ok got that fixed...after waiting again they tell me they are in fact not in network for my insurance after I specifically asked that question prior to making the appt.  They told me I could be seen if I paid the amount for the visit but they wouldn't honor what they told me on the phone...after the clerk at the checkout window got cynical, I grabbed my imagery and stormed out for a 1.5 hour drive home only to find out that now I have to start over and find another doctor and live with this pain even longer...if possible and you have a choice, SEE ANOTHER CLINIC...DO NOT GO TO UNIVERSITY ORTHO!!!

name: Pamela Truelove-Walker
text: Dr. Thompson is a very thoughtful physician. He answers questions patiently, explains medical issues in practical terms, and offers multiple treatment options. He definitely listens to his patients and allows them input as it relates to surgical procedures. I HIGHLY recommend him for any Orthopaedic issues under his practice.

name: Alice Thomas
text: Dr Atkins Jr.  is great. Nice atmosphere. Wait time is very reasonable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Thank you for taking good care of me. Their physical therapy staff is wonderful.

name: Nancy Watkins
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr., did a full knee replacement for me 3 months ago.  A wonderful doctor who is very thorough and takes the time to listen to your concerns as well as answer any questions you may have about your surgery.  One of the most efficiently run offices I have been to - I don’t think I have ever waited more than 15 minutes to be called back.  Also the scheduler for the surgery was very nice and super efficient!  I had to have forms from my regular doctor and my cardiologist signed before the surgery could be scheduled.  She faxed those immediately and my surgery was scheduled for two weeks later.   All of the nurses, x ray technician and office staff could not have been nicer.   I would highly recommend the University Orthopaedic Clinic!

name: Leslie Alexander
text:
My son broke his hand and needed surgery. Dr. Claytor and his nurses were wonderful. Excellent bedside manner and helped this out of state mom feel better about surgery.
Scheduling and setting an appointment was a challenge because they were super busy in Monday. It was worth time I spent getting him scheduled because within 48 hours he was fixed up!

name: Pamela Richey
text: My appointment was at 8:00 o'clock. At 9:00 o'clock I went to the front desk to inquire if I would be seeing the doctor soon. I was told the doctor didn't come in until 9:00 o'clock and I was 4th in line to see him. Um..why schedule 8:00 o'clock appointments, if the doctor doesn't come in until 9:00 o'clock?

name: Rose Walker
text: The Doctors are the best.  The staff and nurse's are very friendly and helpful. I had knee surgery years ago and the doctor and nurse's took excellent care of me. Would recommend to my family and friends. Thank you UOC

name: Taylor Hollis
text: Dr Callahan was great. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Dr. Callahan got me in and out and knew his stuff! Looking forward to working with them in the future.

name: Kaitlyn Moore
text: Dr. Scott, outstanding workers comp experience.  Listens well. Sweat, friendly love him to death. Overall best doc visits I've ever had on anything.

name: Judy Craig
text: Dr.Scott and all the staff have been great at both of my appointments. I didn't feel like I was being rushed out. All around good experience. Would definitely recommend to others.

name: SPoKie DoKie
text: Amazing job. Not only is my affected area healing very well, they even took care to stitch my tattoo back together so there’s no damage. They have kept me informed every step of the way and I have never once been caught offguard with something. I couldn’t recommend them enough.

name: Sandra Dickie
text: Dr. Ikard Jr and UOC are very caring and professional! I could not ask for a better team of medical professionals. Everyone that greeted me from my arrival to my leaving were helpful, kind and encouraging.

name: Andrea Walker
text: My daughter had an knee injury. After being referred to Dr. Scott my daughter and I no idea what to expect. Visits before and after surgery were better than either of us could have imagined. Every step and any questions we had were explained to us with knowledge. Doctor and staff were amazing in both Tuscaloosa and Fayette locations.

name: TipTip *
text: My therapy went well, but I felt as if I needed more time. This was not a work injury, I paid for therapy myself. When I requested more therapy from them I was met with a negative attitude and response.

name: Sabrina West-Bullock
text: Dr.Ikard Sr. is the BEST! I've been under his care for a cyst on my foot. The care he gives, along with his bedside manners, are qualities any patient would dream of having.  He always makes me feel as if I'm being taken care of by a family member or close friend.  My experiences with him and the UOC were exceptional.

name: Charles Burton
text: I would have been a new patient except for the utter rudeness of the receptionist staff. The first young lady talked about me to her colleague as if I wasn't standing there and literally tossed the clipboard on the counter without saying a word. I shrugged my shoulders as to say, "what exactly are you asking me to do?" Her response and tone were totally dismissive and rude. Then, while trying to complete the forms, I was called back to the desk to be asked by the second young lady when I could reschedule. When I asked why I would need to reschedule, I was met with attitude and, again, a dismissive attitude. Admittedly, I was a few minutes late. However, as a potential new patient, I had no idea they had different locations at the time I scheduled the appointment. Therefore, my slight tardiness is attributed to that. I'm sure the actual medical staff is great. However, I can only imagine a loss of business due to the privileged and dismissive attitude of the staff you encounter when you walk thru the door. I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere.

name: Renee Adams
text: I received great care from a professional and caring staff. I’m no longer in debilitating pain after surgery, and so very grateful to Dr. Atkins and his staff.

name: Nell Taylor
text: Dr. Standerffer has been caring for my son and I for more than 10 years and every visit has been excellent. He is caring and patient and I’d recommend that anyone needing orthopedic care see him.

name: Jennifer Ward
text: The doctors a great! However, the front desk lady that sits to the left behind the two ladies in the immediate front at the Northport location is one of the RUDEST ladies I've ever encountered!! She makes  this office look BAD!

name: Barbara Allen
text: The lady who conducted the x-ray study was so kind, gentle, and caring. Dr. Buckley is truly a God send. I was majorly impressed with his wealth of knowledge and his ability to articulate so plainly what was going on with my shoulder. I left the clinic feeling like a million dollars and I have not had any left shoulder pain since treatment at the clinic. Thank you so much ‼️😀

name: Taura
text: Dr. McKibbon is awesome. I appreciate him taking the time to explain everything about my injury & the best treatments for healing. 👍

name: Danita Lightning
text: Very professional and courteous with an answer to every question asked that day! Service with a smile! Everyone seemed like a family!

name: Emmogene Edge
text: Its comforting to find medical services that match or exceed one's former services when one has moved to another state. I found the services at UOC in Tuscaloosa , to be wonderful. They are kind and patient. The staff and my new doctor have inspired my trust and given me confidence to go forward with the prescribed treatment my knees need. Thank you !

name: Mickey Dehaan
text: Dr. Standefer is the best surgeon.  He takes his time to explain things.  I also appreciate how he explains his " plan of care & course of actions".  Annex at Bryant Drive way too many chairs in such a small waiting room.  Every time a patient got up, I had to guard and repositioning my new total knee to avoid it getting smacked into.

name: Sherry Barr
text: Horrible. Made our appointment and gave insurance information in “advance”. They knew my son was in pain but would not see him without a referral from the university student center, even though we went to ER the night before. (But they did not tell us this before we showed up to the appointment) Made us fill out a book load of paperwork and then broke the news. Not concerned at all that this was their mistake, they didn’t even try to make any exception because he was in pain. Rude. Neverrrr again!

name: George Osborne
text: Excellent all the way around. Dr Thompson has operated on me 4 times. Each time my problem was corrected. Follow up visits were great. Very caring and helpful staff. I highly recommend University orthopedic clinic.

name: Betty Hancock
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr did my knee replacement in 2004. He was wonderful and a very precious person. He is such a gentle speaking doctor. He later did carpal tunnel surgery on my right hand and put a cortisone shot in my left hand for carpal tunnel. When my left hand began hurting severely again I called to see Dr. Ikard. I was told he only worked with knees. I was told i could see Dr Callahan for my hand. I saw him yesterday and he said i had end stage arthritis in my thumb joint. He put a shot in it. He was very serious. I wish he would please talk a little more and just have a more pleasant way. I get very nervous around a dr like him. Please Dr Callahan understand, i think you are a knowledgeable dr, but kindness sure helps alot. Dr John Newcomb in Nport Dch er is a very good example of a compassionate dr.

name: Denise
text: Dr. Tosh Atkins is by far the Best Ortho Doctor...He knows his stuff. ...He performed knee and shoulder surgery as of today I feel 120% better...If Dr. Atkins was near me right now...I'd give him a great big kiss...."Thank You and Kudos to a Job Well Done Dr Atkins"

name: Jill Carroll
text:
Everyone from the receptionist to the nurses, to the doctors are friendly knowledgeable and very professional. For joint pain and issues I would not go anywhere but to Dr. Atkins. I had a total knee replacement in my right knee over 20 years ago,  and have not had one minute’s trouble.  Truly appreciate
UOC and their staff.

name: April Soleil
text: That’s great if you’re well experienced and have a reason to come across somewhat arrogant (my uncle is an oncologist and he is a bit arrogant) however when you act like you’re better and in a hurry, have an attitude and say “I told her that I couldn’t aspirate” to the workers as soon as he’s coming back into the door, and bent out of shape because a patient asks questions, and overall a douche attitude- NO THANK YOU!!! Won’t be back. His presence made me feel inferior and less than and like I bothered him to keep him longer than a minute. I like friendly people, personally. If you would like to encounter a straight up a** then Dr Thompson at Northport DCH Medical Plaza (UOC) would be the one! Eek. Never again. I won’t be back to see him unless he wants to see a dose of his own medicine- no pun intended. Good luck boss man. The other staff were great (as why I left more stars than ONE) and I am only referencing Dr Thompson at UOC (Northport DCH medical plaza)

name: Q Crews
text: Dr. Ikard Jr. and the staff here are wonderful people. Kind and courteous, and always listen to your concerns. I will take my future injuries here above all others. Lol
