name: James Mills Jr
text: Dr. Atkins and the staff at UOC are first class. Friendly, efficient, compassionate and talented. I would definately recommend them for your orthopedic needs.

name: Jerry Henson
text: I was extremely pleased with my visit with Dr. Atkins who is a very professional and friendly physician.  He spent a very adequate amount of time with me and answered all of my questions expertly and with clarity.  I would indeed recommend him to all of my family and friends.

name: Pecola Collins
text: Excellent care and the staff is very very nice and caring people. I would recommend UOC   To all of my friends and family!

name: Gunars Cazers
text: This place has it all together. The doctors and staff are comforted and friendly. I have used both the main office in the annex. My only gripe is that they cannot schedule an appointment six months in advance. Their computer program does not go that far in advance. They need to fix it.

name: Lynn Norris
text: University Orthopaedic has been great to meet the needs of my husband and me this year. We have used the physicians offices, MRI, and the therapy staff and  facilities. We highly recommend them to anyone needing Orthopaedic services.

name: Bonnie Buck
text: Dr. Standeffer does a great job explaining situations and concerns. He is kind with helpful advice, especially regarding my health as an older patient and medicines. My shoulder surgery went very well. His encouraging personality helps me to try harder. When you are in pain that can be tough. Excellent doctor and staff.

name: John Perry
text: All I can say is excellent from entry to exit. Kind and effecient office staff. Kind, efficient and competent medical professionals with the procedure.

name: Judith Ingram
text: This was my first experience with Dr. Scott and his office and I was extremely pleased with the service I received. From check-in to check-out the entire staff was friendly and concerned about the patient.

name: Pat Gregg
text: My family has used UOC for many years.  From knee replacements, shoulder surgery, knee scopes etc., we have always been pleased with the caring staff and excellent doctors.  We have a special affinity for Dr. Atkins as he literally put my brother back together after a horrific motorcyle accident.

name: Mary Peacock
text: Dr. Scott and staff were very professional and had excellent bedside manor. They do an awesome job explaining to us the process and answering any questions we had.

name: Teresa Jackson
text: The BEST doctors in Tuscaloosa hands down and I Love the staff so much because they’re the SWEETEST EVER ❤️

name: Jane Richardson
text: The physicians & staff are wonderful; the wait time are acceptable. The quality of patient care is simply outstanding!

name: Emily DeFrance
text:
This post is to make others aware of UOC's internal accounting issues. I personally experienced this situation below on 10/08/2018. If you get a bill from them, double check everything. They are trying to make patients responsible for their own adjustment errors back in 2014. They just caught these errors they made in 2018 because they waited 4 years to audit their books. That being said.......my story below.

UOC is a good organization and has always done a great job whenever I have visited their office. However, I recently received a bill out of the blue saying I owed over $300.00. First and foremost, I pay my bills on time and do not let my accounts become delinquent. I called their office to find out why I received a letter saying I owed money since I was recently just in their office and they never mentioned this balance before. I found out they recently did an audit on September 28th, 2018 and realized they made an internal accounting error from 4 years ago. So when my account was adjusted back from THEIR mistakes, my account showed an open balance and they sent me a bill demanding payment.

Long story short - Their company made an internal accounting error and they just caught this 4 years later and are now trying to back charge their patients for their OWN mistakes in their accounting department. I went down to their office and they were not willing to work things out with me based off of their own negligence in their bookkeeping department. Not until I told them that my attorney and I were going to sue them and I was going to bring in Fox 6 News on your side (to expose their company with what they were doing behind the scenes to their patients) did they try to eliminate my bill from where they made a mistake (now my patient balance is zero - how convenient). I have never heard of any type of business back charging someone for THEIR own mistakes. It's called have a check and balance system in place, perform a yearly audit on your books and train your office staff to do their jobs correctly.

name: Paul Arnold
text: I have been going to UOC for over 10 years and just had a total knee replacement. I was back at work in 6 weeks due to their great Physical Therapy. Dr. Standeffer has always spent extra time explaining things to me and the staff is always friendly.

name: Tracie Barnett
text: My daugther had an appointment to at 8:30 with Dr. Standefer for a cyst that has ruptured. It is painful & swollen! When she got there they took her copay then told her they couldn't see her because her appointment was at 8:00. My daugther told the receptionist that she received a text reminder yesterday that said 8:00. So the receptionist said the text was wrong & she would have to reschedule. Ok that automatic text system belong to them so that was the Dr office fault so I feel like they should have seen her. So I called & talked to the unconcerned receptionist trying to explain to her that my daughter really need to see the Dr today because it was not her fault. She said you want to reschedule because those are Dr. Standefer rules. He told them to tell me to tell her to put a brace on it. She been wearing the brace every since it ruptured. My daughter got to wait another week to see the Dr & be in pain. I just want you all to know God sit high & looks low. You all did my daughter wrong today but you don't have to worry about doing her wrong again. I pray nobody ever do your daughter or son the way you did my daughter today! WHAT GOES AROUND COMES AROUND!!!!  It's so hard as a parent to heard your child crying because they are tired of hurting & there's nothing you can do. Thank God for a Dr & receptionist that was concerned about my daugther hand. She has an appointment...Thank God for favor!!!!

name: Richard Rand
text: Great doctors, great specialists, great nurses, great secretaries.  A truly exceptional team, working together with great efficiency and consideration for the patient.

name: May Hicks
text: Dr. Standefer is a wonderful doctor and has done an outstanding job on multiple injuries I acquired in a car accident. I would highly recommend him or any of his assistants to anyone with any bone or joint injuries. Thank you again Doctor for your superior work and wonderful attitude as well.

name: Jackie Fochtmann
text: Great office staff and Dr. Standeffer is the best.  I have always had a pleasant experience here.

name: Leslie Draper
text: Super friendly staff.  Doctor was very thorough, compassionate, and accommodating. Highly recommended.

name: Twanda White
text: Friendly staff and Dr. Thompson was very nice and precise.

name: Sherry Ellis
text: Pleasant atmosphere. Excellent service from nurse and doctor. Receptionist friendly and provided great service with check in.

name: Rheonna Wiuff
text:
I came to Dr. McKibbin for a second opinion regarding surgery for an ankle injury. I was pleasantly surprised.  His office nurse was very kind, thorough and professional. Took her time taking careful notes and history. Dr. McKibbin was very thoughtful in his questions, physical exam, and spent time reviewing my history,  MRI, Xrays, and Dr.'s notes. He took time more going over my case than I expected. In the end he gave a me his opinions and assessment regarding my injury and treatment.
UPDATE! After seeing Dr. MCKIBBIN for months, him collecting payments for seeing me and telling me one thing about my injury and long term prognosis. He SOLD OUT to the Workmen’s Comp Insurance that pays him and F-ed me out of a fair Work Comp Claim. My injury, as he agreed, I will suffer with the rest of my life and have to make major lifestyle changes to live with. However, he gave Work Comp a different story and assessed me at 0.
Choose your Dr’s carefully, especially if you have a work related injury! If I had known, I would have asked him at the first visit about his rating history and who he felt his loyalty goes to?
If you have a Work Comp case
DO
NOT
CHOOSE
DR.
MCKIBBIN!!!!!!!
He’s a sale out for the insurance check. As long as he gives them low grade assessments and they don’t have to pay out money to the injured parties he stays on their payroll and they send him more patients and it all starts over again.

name: Patricia Pritchett
text: Very efficient and and very comfortable with the staff and Dr Atkins going again as soon as time allows

name: Kristen Watkins
text: I had my knee surgery here several years ago and was very pleased.  My ENTIRE family uses UOC when we need an orthopedic specialist.  One family member in particular uses them for cortisone injections every few months.  The same family member had an accident over the Christmas holiday and needed to be seen after being seen in the E.R. She called to schedule an appointment and was told that it will be Monday Jan. 4TH before they can get her in unless there is a break or fracture.  So she had to go to her primary doctor after the E.R.(pay another 35.00 copay after the 150.00 E.R. copay) to have him order more x-rays.  I called to see if there was any way to get her in trying to explain the situation that she couldn't wait another 6 days even if it wasn't broke or fractured (she can't put any weight on it and its about the size of a softball)  when she originally injured her foot on Dec. 23rd and the receptionist said there was nothing she could do so I ask to speak to the office manager.  I was transferred to Jennifer Germain.  I have never in my life had someone yell at me like she did.  I was a firm believer in UOC until now.  I bet if the physicians knew this is how their practice was being ran they would probably make several staff changes starting with Ms. Germain.  I know that every place of business has rules and I have worked with the public for several years, so I truly get it.  But to yell at someone..... WOW! I don't care if I broke every bone in my body. I'll never be back.( if it was around a holiday it wouldn't matter... they wouldn't be able to fit me in anyways!)

name: Rose Boyd
text: My Dr. was great; his staff not so much. They were not very friendly, could be condescending, but when you get through the surgery and first few office visits - I highly recommend UOC PT!  This is why I rate 5 stars..The staff is exceptional and very friendly. I never once dreaded going to PT. I had rotator cuff surgery and during my therapy sessions Will and/or Stephen would tell me exactly what they were doing and why they were doing it. They were supportive and encouraging.  I felt like a part of the UOC PT family on my first visit.

name: Kenneth Tingle
text: Every time I visit UOC I’m there 2 to 3 hours and thats ridiculous.   Just for a shot.  The doctors are good but the wait time is horrible

name: Jennifer Mack
text: Friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere and no time wasted.

name: A snarling Fetus
text: I had a terrible experience here. They deleted my last review off of this page, because I was not at all satisfied with the "treatment" I received here. I was made fun of by the staff for wanting to put my broken tibia in a hard cast. When they finally took it off they xrayed my leg again and it was still broken. At this point the doctor told me I was fine, and I should immediatly start walking on it. This was definitly not the case, and I am expecting to have surgery now 6 months later to fix the 2 completly disalligned tendons these idiots failed to even recognize. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME with these people.

name: Kimberly Grammer
text: As always Dr. Standerfer and staff was caring and professiona! I called 1 day and was given an appointment within days.

name: Heather Spires
text: A bunch of sweet staff !! Had me in and out in no time !

name: Brett Grady
text: I had both knees worked on, separately. By Dr.Claytor. he is really good. He will do a great job, and you will get the proper pre and post op treatments, and meetings. You will be glad if you choose him. I had repair of the meniscus due to tears. I am now doing a lot better. I am glad I got the surgery done. I have never waited to long for an appointment. The Dr. Is top notch...i can say because of how I feel after the procedures. The staff at the Tuscaloosa clinic, and the Northport clinic are always friendly, kind, professional, and always smiling. Appropriately smiling...no fakers here! They want you to feel good, and I always did, and still do. These people know what proper bedside manner is, and I thank them for it. The surgical center at Northport is equally kind, curtious, professional, caring...if it sounds like I am pitching for them...no, I am telling you that if you need this type of help/care...UOC...that is where you find it.

name: arlene hiatt
text: My husband and I are from Nebraska and do extended visits in Madison twice a year to visit our son and family.  During our stay in Oct/Nov, we saw Alexander Sarazen at Spine Care Madison.  He is gentle, caring, and professional.   The staff at Spine Care Madison is great.  We highly recommend Spine Care Madison.

name: Abby Edwards
text:
Dr. H  is either the best chiropractor in the world or a wizard. I came to him with some non-spine related issues. The first being constant or daily migraines/headaches for over a month. All of these headaches came about pretty sudden, but I swear only two/three visits with him and I have not had a serious headache since. He was able to loosen up areas of my shoulders and neck that was causing me a ton of strain...
The second issue being TMJ- most people wouldn't think to go to a chiropractor for TMJ, but do it!! Two whole weeks I could not open my mouth or enjoy my favorite foods..... y'all-ONE visit with him and I am pain free. The staff is absolutely amazing! Everyone is so kind and always has your best interest in mind. Thanks SpineCare!

name: Debbie McGowan
text: Dr. Houssain and the staff at Madison SpineCare are great! My husband has neck problems due to a car accident and age. He always looks forward to his appointments every couple of weeks. Always very professional but also make you feel like family!

name: James Hames
text: SpineCare has been awesome. I would recommend you trying it even if you think “I don’t need a chiropractor” because I thought that as well, but I definitely need a chiropractor!

text: Dr. Houssain is a great chiropractor. Very knowledgeable, friendly, & personable. His staff if very friendly as well!

name: kala emmons
text: I was gifted with an hour massage (per Groupon) and Beth was amazing! I left feeling so relaxed and the pain in my neck was gone! I will be back!

name: Stacy Tidwell
text: My back is finally better thanks to SpineCare!! Thank you for getting me back to normal!! Great office and staff! The doctors are awesome!

name: Trip Ogden
text: Dr. Anthony Houssein and his staff are wonderful I would never willing go somewhere else.

name: Natalie Tidwell
text: Great office, especially loved the attentiveness and friendliness of the nurse/techs during the initial part of my visits

name: Anne Chelekis
text: I absolutely LOVE my visits to SpineCare.  I have arthritis in my right hip, and while there is nothing to cure it, there are ways of treating it, and lessening the pain.  When I first went to SpineCare, I thought the severe pain was because of my knee,   Dr. Houssain immediately diagnosed my condition after studying my MRI and x-rays, as being a deteriorated hip due to arthritis.  The pain in my knee was due to using my i t band to compensate for the weak hip.  ( there was absolutely nothing wrong with my knee!). He then gave me some therapeutic exercises to strengthen my back, so that I would rely less on my I t band muscle.  Now that I understand what’s going on with my joints and how to properly treat the arthritis, my pain level most days is way down from what it used to be.  Now when I leave my SpineCare appointment, I feel so good and relaxed,  it’s almost like going to a spa!  Thanks Dr. Houssain - you’re the best!

name: Willie Anderson
text: Dr. Hussein is the best He started working on my back about two weeks ago  today I am able to do things that I wasn’t able to do before I started seeing him I can walk without hurting now I can walk up to mile and a half No pain and  a lot of my pain is gone thanks to Dr. Hussein I recommend anybody with back pain to go see Dr. Hussein you’ll start feeling better within days go see him

name: Ryan
text: Total waste of money.  The staff was friendly but the doctor didn’t do anything but try and get as much money as he could. He said my symptoms were normal and would go away.  Put a tens unit on me for ten mins rubbed some icy hot on my back. Then pops my upper back when my lower back was the problem, tried to sell me a back brace to drive in. The best part is when I come back on my next visit I’ll get a core exercise routine.  Now I  guarantee it’s the same xerox sheet he gives to everyone and could have handed it to me today. That’ll be $90 and charged me for the sticky pads he used on my back. Complete waste of money and time off of work.  Should have googled my symptoms.

name: Susan Bish
text:
My husband suffered 13 years with lower back pain.  He went through physical therapy, pain management and even surgery to have his tailbone removed. Nothing helped until he met Dr. Houssain. Within three weeks, his pain subsided and within five weeks, the pain was gone.

I went to Dr. Houssain six months later with lower back pain and bursitis. I have been seeing him for five weeks and amazingly, I am now able to sleep a full night for the first time in four years, go back to my exercise classes and resume my life to the fullest.

Dr. Houssain takes all the time you need, answers any questions and is extremely knowledgeable. He has a wonderful staff that is friendly and very helpful .

name: Sharon J Smith
text:
After pain in foot kept me from walking more than 20 mins on my treadmill, I went to a podiatrist, who said surgery. I asked friends for chiropractor recommendations to see if something less invasive would work. Saw Dr. Houssain and did a thorough physical exam of my foot and asked lots of questions. He began therapy for cleaning out fibrotic tissue and made suggestions for exercise and range of motion as to not cause further inflammation and healing could began.
I’m now up to an hour on my treadmill, no pain and beyond thankful!
Another issue the Dr. helped me work through was chronic pain in left shoulder blade, turns out it was my posture (head hung, reading and looking down at phone...). It is completely gone and I so appreciated him teaching me how I could keep that from reoccurring! I’m all about education, prevention and non invasive, non drug options, if at all possible!
Thank you, Dr. Houssain! I so appreciate you. Very friendly, professional, kind staff also!

name: MissSlipjig
text: Dr. Houssain is excellent! I haven't been to his office in over a year and half but that's only because he fixed all my problems. :)

name: Steven Sims
text: Very competent and knowledgeable staff. Massage was great and Dr. Houssain was excellent!

name: Raymond Webb
text:
I am a 71 year old Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS) patient. I have suffered accelerated degenerative disc disease (DDS), spondylosis, and stenosis  in my spine, since age 38. In the past 15 years, my condition has necessitated a spinal fusion (L5-S1), a microdiscectomy (L4-L5),  and a neck (cervical) fusion (C3-C4).       The surgeries were successful with the last neck surgery sparing me from becoming a paraplegic or death. I have been blessed with excellent surgeons and caregivers. I'm grateful.
I had tried chiropractor prior to my surgeries. The chiropractor worked diligently with me. I also worked hard doing all to help myself. The effort did not help. I would suppose my spine had too many mechanical issues at that time.
As I aged, my condition worsened until I was bed fast 18 hours or more each 24 hour cycle. One day as I was laying in bed , the latter part of 2015, I thought maybe I should try chiropractor services again. After all, the surgeries had alleviated some of the worst mechanical problems in my spine. I had 7 primary points of pain. The pain between my shoulder blades was the worse, a grating, stinging type of pain. My thoughts were, If I can knock out 80% of that pain, I would be 30-40% better overall. Also, this pain would mushroom into total body pain, unless I was able to quiet the pain. Laying on ice gel packs would help quiet the pain.
I obtained the services of Dr. Anthony Houssain at SpineCare.  My first meeting (Jan. 2016) with Dr. Houssain, I laid out my objective. My objective was to lessen the pain between the shoulder blades by 80%.  Dr. Houssain set me on a treatment path to help me accomplish my objective. He was encouraging and very knowledgeable. Dr. Houssain believed he could give me back a part of my life that I had lost.
On my second visit,  Dr. Houssain manipulated 3 vertebrates in my thoracic area. I went home and lay down. I had a first, two hours pain free between the shoulder blades. Now, I had hope and believed we were on the right path to accomplish my goal. He has helped me not only to obtain my objective , but to exceed my objective. At times, I do have pain between my shoulder blades. When I experience the pain, I execute the home part of Dr. Houssain's treatment program. Dr. Houssain's treatment program with other tools in my toolbox are sufficient to manage and mostly alleviate the pain between the shoulder blades.
I love the game of golf. Seven or eight years ago, I was having a good day for me. My son and I decided to play a round of golf. My whole body was in pain after the round. I got home, went to my room, shut the door, and cried my heart out. I was in total body pain and believed I would never play golf again. This was my last round of golf with my son. I did not hit a golf ball for another 7-8 years.
After the pain between my shoulder blades was mostly alleviated and/or pain level lessened, it was time to attempt a round of golf again. On April 19, 2016, I played golf with my son, shooting 89. I was sore, but did not have any serious side-effects. I now play golf, about once a week. I am now able to be up more hours per day.
My objective was accomplished with Dr. Houssain's help. In fact, it would not have happened without him. I am not well, but I have a much better life. Will I continue to improve or will the good ride end? I don't know, but I know it been a much better ride since April. I thank the good Lord for putting people in my life to help me, Dr Houssain being one of those people.
I know every one is different, and one may obtain better results than me, or not obtain as good results as me. But, I always have kept trying to find any nugget that would help me be better. I hope those who read this, will keep trying to find that nugget for themselves. If one keeps trying, they may well find the nugget that makes their life better.. Keep on, keeping on. God bless you in your journey.

name: Cheryl Conrad
text: After struggling with heel pain for 6 months, I finally went to a medical specialist.  Without x-rays, MRI, etc., he told me I had heel spurs & the only thing to do was surgery.  I then went to a 2nd specialist who said I did not need surgery, wearing a boot for 4-6 weeks should take care of it.  Again no MRI.  After 6 months in the boot & still the same level of pain, the doctor said the only thing that would help would be surgery.  During those 6 months, I met 4 people who had the same problem & either had the surgery & had to have a 2nd surgery to correct the first or gave up when the surgery didn't work.  I went on the internet & read about Chiropractors  & their success with patients with heel spurs.  I made an appointment with Dr. Hussain at Spine Care & he ordered an MRI which showed my problem was not spurs but Achilles tendonitis & a tear in the tendon. After 3 months of treatment, I am out of the boot & in no pain.  I can't thank the doctor enough.  I only wish I had gone to him first.

name: AD Williams
text:
Dr Houssain and the staff is my first point of contact for any injury that does not involve a bone sticking out.  They have seen all five of my family members.  In each case he has evaluated the injury.  He has sent us out for MRI/XRay when necessary.  (In my opinion, practices with XRay/MRI have a tendency to use them every time and cost more money...)  For each injury, he has provided an easy to remember and execute program of exercises to build strength in the area of concern.  He provided excellent referrals to other medical providers when necessary.  He is always looking for literature backed programs of treatment.

(I have been a SpineCare patient for nearly three years now for an over 20 year old case of Degenerative Disc Disorder.  Dr Houssain has kept me out of surgery, for which I am greatful!)

I highly recommend using SpineCare.

name: Chaun Reed
text: Staff was very friendly and after my adjustments I feel great! I will be a regular patient here.

name: Eric C. (Revsin)
text: Complete robbery. It's a place like this that gives chiropractic medicine the title of 'quackery'. No x-rays, no mri, no physical. The 'doctor' went into a long sales pitch, honestly trying to sell me on a treatment. Had to pause and ask, "Do you even know why I'm here?" to which he had no idea why I was there. Waste of time and money, I didn't go to see a powerpoint slideshow on an iPad. I came for help... I want my money back!

name: Priscilla Akwuba
text: The staff there were so friendly and kind, they really knew the job very well . I have been there three times but I felt like I have been going there , I do not feel much pain again. They have  good workers . Competent workers. Please PT Solutions of Montgomery should keep it up 👍

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your care!  We are glad you are getting relief from your symptoms.

name: Logann Shorter
text: I really enjoyed the service, the exercices were consistant, and the staff was very nice to me! Overall great physical therapy clinic!

name: Yvette Sanders
text: Easy to get too, Friendly and courteous staff.  Facility is clean and very well equipped.  Recommend this location for all your PT needs.

resp.text: Yvette, It was a pleasure working with you. Thank you so much for trusting us with your care and recommending us!

name: David Herman
text:
I had a knee replacement two years ago and needed help in bending and straightening my knee recently. I went to PT solutions and with the help of Dr. Wylie Hayes, I have seen great improvement in regaining mobility in my knee and have far less pain and can move my knee much better than before.
I had customized one on one treatment with my physical therapist and everyone at the facility was very warm, welcoming and encouraging.
I highly recommend this professional company if you need help with any of your physical therapy needs.

David Herman

name: Yvonne Fenoglio
text:
I was having some hip pain and could barely get out of bed  let alone walk. I came to PT Solutions thinking Dry Needling was the only thing that would help (I have had it before and knew that would be a good quick fix). Then I met AJ. He assessed me, got me on the table, showed me some stretches and gave me a quick dry needling devised a customized  plan for me. SO for the next few sessions I went tp PT, and started to feel some relief.After about a week I really noticed the pain relief and started noticing some strength! We started tapering the visits and increasing my strength building at each session. Before long I was able to lift weights and do things that I thought I would never be able to and (somethings I had never done before). Now I am on my own having completed my PT and feeling so much stronger! The encouragement from AJ, and the customer service from all really help with my great experience and my healing! Thank you PT Solutions East. You all are the best. I would Highly Recommend them!
Clean, professional and Knowledgeable.

name: Donald Scott
text: I have had back pain for many years. The Doctor I was using at the time, said surgery was my only option. After several years of dealing with the pain, I went to another back Doctor. He x-rayed and sent me for a new MRI. He told me there was no need for surgery and set me up with PT Solutions East for physical therapy. Within the first three visits, the pain was all but gone. Over the next couple of weeks of therapy, the lower back pain totally disappeared. My back pain was due to core muscle weakening. Not only has my back pain gone, but my balance and poster has greatly improved. The staff has worked and taught me how to tighten up my core muscles and also taught me how to keep them that way. The staff at PT Solutions East are great to work with, are caring and genuinely interested in helping you get better.

text: My 13-yr old daughter has had a swimming injury in her shoulder since last Oct (it's June) that we haven't been able to fix, despite seeing a surgeon and 2 months of PT plus 4 months of rest. name: M Jones
text: Been struggling with a hamstring injury for almost a year. Went to multiple PTs, chiropractors and orthopedic doctors with no improvement. After the 1st visit with Dr. Olsen, I had immediate relief. The Active Release Technique works amazingly, and his other treatments and recommendations have me feeling better than I have in a long time. Looking forward to being injury free, and I believe Dr. Olsen is the only person in Huntsville that will get me there!

name: Kevin Meier
text: Drs. Olsen, Robinson, and staff will, simply put, fix you. Whatever you're pain, they have a plan. They're warm and welcoming personalities will first put you at ease. Then they're expertise in all things chiropractic, from soft tissue massage, light to moderate stretching, to spinal and neck adjustments, are all part of their holistic approach to your well being. They will gladly work with your regular doctor or specialist to provide the best care available. Whether it's neck pain, back pain, plantar fasciitis, or sports injury, they'll get you moving freely again.

name: Alura Young
text:
Dr. Robinson is absolutely FANTASTIC. He's the only reason why I tried the new place after he moved from Spincare. Unfortunately, I won't be returning here due to the way this company deals with their customers financially.
I saw Dr. Robinson back in October 2017 and again in November 2017. He's always great, he has great bedside manners, and he cracks me up.  Everything was awesome as usual. I paid my copay, was told I have a $0 balance, and was good to go both times. I never like to have balances, so I pay whatever I owe when I see a doctor.
Fast forward SEVEN MONTHS LATER, I get a BILL in the mail for unpaid fees that apparently only went towards my deductable and now I owe $88. I called last Monday and was told I'd have to call next Monday to speak to the billing person, so I waited 7 more days and called today. She went over the bill in detail, including how they even gave me some discount to adjust my bill as if they're doing me a favor.
I maintained my voice and words and told her I guess I have no choice but to pay this bill, even though you guys waited over a half year to bill me. I told her I was coincidentally planning on coming back to see Dr. Robinson again but now that I got this bill, I'll be going somewhere else. She told me "well I'm sorry you feel that way."
So, that's that. I'll miss Dr. Robinson because he's literally a miracle worker, but this billing and the way the company manages their patient's accounts is **extremely** unprofessional.  It does not take 7 months for people's health insurance to get back to you. This is 100% P3's fault due to negligence, laziness...maybe both.

What's funny is my husband got a free massage session from them in the mail the same week I got that bill...he hasn't seen Dr. Robinson in over a year.

name: Stephan Onisick
text:
Dr. Olsen gave me exact treatment that I wanted and needed. I came in looking for remedies to two conditions caused from working as programmer which entailed  too much time sitting with a screen and keyboard.

I had injured myself from improperly getting up and twisting as I came out of a swivel chair and also from straining to see the screen.

In short I had a muscular problem in my lower back and neck.  I expressed my feeling that I was not looking for long-term weekly visits; I just wanted to deal with the painful areas and move-on.

My philosophy seemed to jell with his.  He was friendly, professional and courteous.
I had four treatments in all. On my third visit, my neck pain was my predominant complaint.  He showed me some exercises and also used a laser treatment which really helped with the pain.

I would recommend him to anyone with back pain and I would have no hesitancy in using an MD in the mix as well.

Stephan Onisick

text: Caring and personable staff. Patient-centered treatment plan, not just a standardized generic approach. They researched ideas to help me improve my flexion and thanks to their efforts, I have finally regained my ability to play the guitar. I will forever be indebted!

text: The entire staff is friendly, professional, and truly cares about helping you get better. The atmosphere is cheerful, and I'm always in a better mood when I leave. I have full confidence in all of the therapists abilities, and they've treated my shoulder well. I'm also now a big fan of dry needling, when it can help! They are like physical magicians :)

name: Matt Jons
text: The crew at Therapy South Chelsea is fantastic. I would recommend anyone needing PT that lives in the Chelsea area, to go here if you want the very best recovery and overall experience. I had a serious injury & surgery and am very active in life sports. The staff knew they had to get me back in peak shape so I would be able to compete and enjoy sports again. I want to give a special thanks to Erick for helping me get thru this process. It was not easy, but he knew what I needed and encouraged me to be patient and assured me that I would achieve a total recovery. Also, the receptionist, Hannah,  is very efficient & pleasant to work with. A business is only as good as their people and their ability to work as a team. This place is A+ in the people & teamwork department.

resp.text: Thank you Matt! We strive to give patients the best quality of life by providing exceptional care while they are with us!

name: Joanne Williamson
text: The team was very professional and knowledgeable. I would recommend them to anyone needing therapy.

name: Donald Slee, Jr
text:
I have chosen Therapy South Chelsea for the second time in two years to provide me with therapy services to assist me with recovery from my second total knee replacement.  My first experience (in February 2016) led me straight back to the team at Therapy South Chelsea in February 2018 for therapy to assist in recovery from my final total knee replacement.
I was very impressed with the level of expertise, quality of service and the professionalism of the Director (Robby Head), Therapists (Abby and Erick) and the Office Administrator, Hannah, who assisted me with "juggling" sometimes last minute appointments due to a difficult work schedule.
Following my surgery, I was quickly put into a program which aided in restoring full mobility and avoided what I have heard is typical "stiffness" due to the formation of scar tissue.
I can recommend, without any hesitation or reservation whatsoever, Therapy South Chelsea as the premier provider of Physical Therapy in our area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Don! We are thankful to have been able to get you going after both of your surgeries.

While the mechanics of rehab may not always be pleasurable the environment in which you rehab can be, Therapy South in Chelsea is a pleasurable place in which to rehab because of the quality of the people who work there. They are professional yet a joy to be around. I would recommend them and will use them again in the future as the need arises.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mr. Studdard! We enjoy working with you!

name: Elizabeth Cooley
text: TherapySouth Chelsea is where I would recommend anyone, post-surgery or with chronic pain, to go for physical therapy. The therapist are phenomenal in all areas of their field. They listen and work with you according to what is going on with your body. I've done my physical therapy after ACL replacement surgery and my knee is stronger than it has ever been. I'm currently doing therapy on lower back issues and I'm getting better each day. I've even got my mom going for pain management. This is the place to go for physical therapy. I think of the physical therapist and Hannah, Kelly and Andrew as if they were my family, that is just how much they care. I feel so blessed that they are located in Chelsea, AL.

resp.text: Thank you Elizabeth! You were a pleasure to work with and we are happy to have helped you achieve your goals!

name: Clark Kelley
text: Every one was great and professional

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Ashley Arrowood
text:
My journey with physical therapy began during the most painful time in my life to date.  I never imagined the experience would become so personal.  At my first visit, I met with Robby to discuss all my issues.  He has a genuine nature, a respect for where you are in the process, and a drive to see you return to wellness.  He took the time to evaluate me and was methodical in his design of a plan that worked not only in the clinic but could be transitioned to home. He championed me through tough times with kindness, professionalism, and a warmth that led to a trust which is necessary for the recovery process to be successful.  He is a credit to his profession and an asset to TherapySouth.
Throughout the following weeks, I worked with Abbey.  Abbey is truly a pioneer in her field.  She is focused and attentive during every session, kind, compassionate, knowledgeable, and helpful.  When I was doubtful, she was always there to encourage me, being honest with me about the challenges I would face, yet reassuring me that I would one day be able to return to a life filled with many athletic endeavors.  Abbey is understanding and genuinely takes a personal interest in how you're feeling.  She always made sure to explain every exercise in depth and also how it would aid in my progress going forward.  I feel lucky to have been guided by Abbey along my PT journey, for it was her encouragement that pushed me through when I was at my lowest.
Hannah is also extremely helpful and efficient.  Being the face you see when you first walk in, she is cheerful and always greets the patients by name.  TherapySouth has an amazing team and, more importantly, great teamwork.  It is modern and very nice, clean, and an extremely well-run practice.  I couldn't be happier with my experience with something I wasn't at all looking forward to.
Thank you to the TherapySouth team for always answering my questions with interest and patience.  You guys have truly made my recovery a more pleasant experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Ashley! I am thankful you are doing so well!

name: charles lewis
text: Love you guys!!

resp.text: Thanks Mr. Lewis! Glad you are doing well!

name: Dennis Gentle
text: One of the best at diagnosing possible causes of symptoms in one office visit and providing clear, understandable, logical explanations that I have ever encountered.  Outstanding professionalism, bed side manner and common courtesy.  After visiting another doctor for an evaluation of my sons back pain and being told “oh he’s just young and probably strained something. Give it a few weeks and if it doesn’t get better check back with us”, I immediately scheduled an appt for him with Dr Casey.  In one office visit, after doing a thorough evaluation, we were told what she suspected it to be.  A fractured vertebrae.  This was confirmed by subsequent contrast mri.  I have seen Dr Casey myself for a pain that turned out to be something orthopedics don’t treat.  However she had her team forward her evaluation on to my primary care and ordered the additional tests I would need for him to confirm the diagnosis.  So I had the results my primary care needed.  As a result it saved me a visit to my primary care and I received relief quicker as a result.  Which also saved me time off from work and another copay.  And she’s a Birmingham native working for the most prestigious orthopedic center in the area.  One of the best in her field.

name: April Adams
text: Dr. Casey is a very thorough doctor and was willing to get to the bottom of getting rid of my pain. She is smart and has a great bedside manner. And her staff is easy to work with.

name: Toya Williams
text: Only gave one star because it is the lowest I can give. I saw Dr Casey 6 weeks ago with a bad break on my thumb. It covered more than 50% of the joint surface (confirmed by second opinion with a hand specialist). She recommended a thumb cast and told me as long as I didn't mind a bump on my finger it would heal. She told me it was healing at 5 weeks even though the x-ray looked the same as the first. She told me to quit wearing the cast and start to use it. If it wasn't better in 2 weeks I would need to see a surgeon. Well I saw a surgeon today and it is too late to fix my thumb. He put a stack splint on to try and pull the bones together so fibrous tissue can form and help with my pain. I will never have full function of my thumb again, it won't bend all the way due to the break. And I will never be able to use my thumb without pain. It will also get arthritis because it was left untreated. Basically, the 5 weeks I spent under Dr Casey's care was a complete waste of my time. I hope no one else falls into this same situation.

text: Referred to Dr Smith by the Emerg Room Doc at Grandview after falling and breaking my hand. Dr Smith and his entire staff at Southlake Orthopaedics Sports Medicine & Spine Center on Valleydale Road (near I-65) have been awesome. name: Katherine Neill
text: I cannot say enough about Dr. Ryan and his team. They have went above and beyond throughout my recovery, ensuring I have a great comeback story. Coming into my first appointment, I was so nervous about the possibility of a hip scope. Dr. Ryan took the time to explain the procedure and what my recovery would be like. I am a nurse, but he still talked to me like I was a normal patient. He was so kind and appreciative to me for what nurses are doing throughout the pandemic. When I went back for my first post op appointment, he showed me photos of my hip that were taken during the procedure. He explained each picture and what was happening in each one. Dr. Ryan and his team have been there as soon as I call with a question or emergency. Even now, a little half way through recovery, I still get nervous about my hip. Kirby and Dr. Ryan have assured me that everything I’m feeling now is normal and will get better over time. I cannot recommend these guys enough. They have truly been the best people to work with. I cannot thank them enough. Such a great experience with wonderful people!

resp.text: Ms Neill, thank you so much for the very kind words.  We are honored you chose our team to help take care of you.  Looking forward to seeing you back to full-go in no time.  Thanks!

They would most defiantly be worth traveling too if there service was needed if your up to it.

name: Marcus Christianson
text: When I initially went to Dr Ryan, I had been on and off crutches for several years. I had a core decompression on hips that went bad. I could barely walk enough to get to my car and couldn't reach my feet. I'm an active duty police lieutenant and firearms instructor. It's hard to teach on the range on crutches and barely able to walk 25 yards. My officers were begging to stop hurting myself for them and retire. Dr. Ryan advised what he thought was best and explained my options and was honest about which options he thought would work. Unlike other experiences he didn't push for surgery, just suggested it as the best option and would do what I decided,  His staff were very kind and caring. Always seemed to remember me. They were careful to explain to my wife and meet her needs to be my caregiver while I healed. The orthopedic surgery pre-op staff and nurses were kind and went out of their way to check on me both prior and after my surgery. Both hospital stays, at St. Thomas, I had the most amazing hospital nurses I've ever had during all my hospital stays in the past, I've had plenty. They not only took of me, but took care of the family that stayed with me, especially my wife. They were careful to check on her needs too. Physical therapy in the hospital, therapist were careful to explain what they were showing me and  watched for my safety. Wish I would have known about Andrews Sports Medicine and St. Thomas Hospital years ago. I am still healing from second hip replacement. I can now reach my feet, put on my own socks and shoes, pick something off the floor, get in my truck and start looking for a time to ride my Harley. Haven't even to just sit on it in three years. Because of Doc and all the others involved I can walk and serve the public for more years, I can teach on the range, I can play with my grandchildren. I'm going from can't get off the bed to being able to get down the steps to enter my house. Still hurting some, still healing, learning to walk again. I know this is wordy, but I can't thank everybody enough for their professionalism and caring. I can have some quality of life and career  back.

resp.text: Mr. Christianson, thank you so much!  My team and I are thrilled you are doing well, and it was our pleasure to facilitate your recovery.  Take care!

name: Thomas D. Weber
text:
As a former physician I must congratulate the developers of your patient protocol at Andrews Sports Medicine. Very well streamlined and flows very well without having to campout in the waiting room, which can seem like a infinite amount of time.

I found both Dr. Ryan and his entire staff to be nothing less than OUTSTANDING. It was evident in many ways beginning with his scheduling staff having  to deal with so many unknowns as a result of COVID-19. Personally I was expecting delays in my surgical procedure, but to my surprise, delight and shock my procedure was performed at its regular scheduled time, without any delay. Something almost unheard of with the present state of how COVID-19 has interrupted so many functions of our everyday life.

Dr. Ryan's professionalism and bedside manner was phenomenal, from the time he entered the treatment room till the time he left the room, from answering all my questions and concerns to my satisfaction. It also goes without saying I am totally satisfied with how both my surgical procedure went and how fast I have been able to recover. His skills as a surgeon are excellent.

In closing,  I am a very satisfied patient. therefore in the future and  if I should ever need further orthopedic care Andrew's Sports Medicine with always be the first place I will go.

Sincerely,
Dr. Thomas D. Weber

text: Very professional....from the girls that make your appointment, check you in and the x-rays technician.   Everyone is incredibly kind and caring!  Dr. Woessner made me feel very comfortable and the shot I got in my elbow... fixed my pain!!  Thank you Dr. Woessner!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Lisa. We take patient satisfaction seriously and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us!

Best Regards,

Derek A. Woessner, MD, FAAFP

name: Donald R Parks
text: Professional, courteous friendly staff. Dr. Woessner greeted me as if we had been friends for many years. He spent time getting to know me as a person, not just another patient. He demeanor put me at ease and made me feel comfortable describing my medical condition. Dr. Woessner went beyond making a clinical diagnosis but took the time to explain my situation in terms I could understand. When he began to perform the procedure he made sure I understood what was to done and why and the expected results. After the procedure, he took time to further explain possible follow on treatment processes. Top of the line professional. I highly recommend him.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Donald R. We take patient satisfaction seriously and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us!

Best Regards,

Derek A. Woessner, MD, FAAFP

name: Susanna Taylor
text: This is the only orthopaedic doctor I will see!! Awesome Dr and awesome place!

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Susanna. We take patient satisfaction seriously and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us!

Best Regards,

Derek A. Woessner, MD, FAAFP

name: Kimberly Tate
text: Wonderful bedside manner, does not make you feel rushed, and thoroughly explains your conditions to make sure you understand what you have going on before you leave his office. He also went out of his way during my own appointment to look at my son's MRI and give me a 2nd opinion on his athletic injury. Highly recommended and I look forward to completing my care with him and his staff.

name: Martha Greene
text: My visit was very timely and thorough.   I really like Dr. Woessner, great bedside manner and gives several options instead of just one.  I look forward to seeing results.  The entire office staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Linda Partridge
text: Very helpful with my back issues. He used charts to explain, and only after I understood the reasons for my symptoms did he diagnose and render treatment. Not only is he very thorough, he is also very easy to talk with.  He is an excellent doctor!

name: Deborah Murray
text: My experiences have been awesome. The staff as well as Dr. Woessner are very friendly and professional.  Dr. Woessner doesn't try to push anything on you.  If you don't want the procedure that he's suggesting then he provides you with other choices. I really like the atmosphere here. These are wonderful caring doctors. Thank you for taking care of me.

name: Rechell Germany
text: I like how they listen to your concerns .. and pin point the problem .. Ashley & Dr Woessner understand the concerns of having a crucial pain and a bad moment. but most of all I like the way they make you feel better understand the circumstances

name: Anna Collazo
text: Dr. Woessner is great! He takes time to listen to your chief complaints for visit and also goes over other ailments with you. Staff is friendly professional and takes time to help you. Their building is super clean and easy to access.

name: JoAnn Crysel
text: Dr Woessner is a great doctor. He was recommended to me by another dr of mine! Dr Woessner takes his time to explain the issues to his patients in the way they will understand! He comes highly recommended from me! Thumbs up to him and all the staff👍

name: Lisa Orum
text:
Dr Woessner, is the coolest most professional friendly Dr I've ever had!!! This man doesn't even wear Dr scrubs!! He dresses up up( I meant to say that twice😊) He has blazer,shirt,the,dress slacks and dress shoes EVERY TIME I GO IN!!!! WHAT'S BEST IS HIS KNOWLEDGE AND BED SIDE MANNER!!!
IF IT TAKES LONGER THEN WHAT HE THINKS IT SHOULD TAKE TO COME IN .......HE ALWAYS COMES IN EXPLAINS WHY AND APOLOGIZES!! I APPRECIATE THAT!! MOST DRS I HAVE GONE TO COULD CARE LESS ABOUT HOW LONG YOU HAVE BEEN WAITING
I WENT TO DR WOESSNER AT ANOTHER LOCATION BEFORE HE EVER STARTED WORKING HERE. WHEN I CALLED TO MAKE AN APPT WITH HIM AND THEY SAID HE WAS NO LONGER THERE....... I SEARCHED AND SEARCHED UNTIL I FOUND HIM❤❤❤❤
SIGNED A SATISFIED PATIENT

name: Allison Russo
text: We absolutely love Drs. Woessner and Murphy. We have used them for a wide variety of sports injuries with my 5 children; from 3 torn ACLs, a broken foot, 2 torn labrums, a broken hand, and consulting with my teens on sports recovery and energy and muscle management. They both are extremely personable, professional and trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you, Ms. Shows for your feedback! And thanks for choosing SBJS to care for your orthopedic needs!

name: Beth Conley
text: Dr. Timothy Haley did an outstanding job stitching our son's arm up in an emergency surgery! The billing department there is completely incompetent though. I have been disputing incorrect charges for a year now. Every other bill is paid off from his accident! They do not understand the basic concepts of re-filing a claim with a proper code. If you are a military family good luck, because they will not fix Tricare claims at all. Instead, they will send you to collections repeatedly, even when they admit it is an error on their end. Just what we need to deal with between deployments. The head of insurance and the office manager will not return your calls (or speak to you) concerning your bill. I’ve just received a second attorney’s notice of debt, after I was assured their office had handled it. Marcella needs to be removed from her position or placed in a job that she can actually handle. Insurance is over her head.

resp.text: Ms. Conley - we apologize that we did not meet your expectations. We would like to discuss this further with you to make sure that your concerns are addressed. If you would, please email pr@southernbone.com with the best phone number to reach you.

text: Dr. Haley is awesome and his nurse practioner, Lauren Callander, was amazing when I had her today too. Very friendly and extremely patient!

name: Dawn Finch
text:
I have been seeing Dr. Haley for several months now and been diagnosed with severe neck degeneration.  One of my medications is Tylenol 3 which I take 3 times a day for pain. I have been trying to get a refill for a week now and all I'm getting is " we need the doctors permission " to refill and he isn't in today, oh he is doing surgery's today,  oh he is seeing patients and will contact you as soon they can.  I'm not asking for oxycontin for God's sake,  although that would help better than tylenol!  One week may not seem like a big deal to you people but to someone in constant pain, it's unbearable.  And I have called every day for 4 days and you have the audacity to be rude to me??
Just call in a prescription! Every time I have been there, they are standing around doing nothing!!

resp.text: Ms. Finch - we apologize that we did not meet your expectations. If you would like to discuss your experience further, please email pr@southernbone.com. Thank you and Happy New Year.

Maddox had to endure the pain that my wife is going through then I would hope he would understand what my wife is going through when did doctors stop listening to their patients,patients that have medical history that showsDr Mattox is a pain in the a$$..

text: They don't answer the phone I've called on three separate occasions within there business hours to make an apointment and not once have they answered.

text:
Two  trips to sbj and to turn arounds because someone messed the  referrals up!

FYI: southern bone and joint my lawyer will be in contact soon!

name: Jennifer Payne
text: The office personal is the worst. They have no follow through with insurance disputes, do not return phone calls, and then can't answers questions. I took my husband there. He had an xray and the first Doctor could see bone fragmants and almost all disks they could see were compressed. Took months and a very irritated phone call to get an mri. Got the mri now they say that he has no bone fragments or compressed disks. Yhe muscles are still cramping and their advice was to see a neurologist.

name: Rex Lantz
text:
Had appointment yesterday with Jennings for damaged ankle, badly swollen and discolored.  Big open area with windows and tellers like a bank when you go in.  Find the correct window then check in.  The girl there was chewing her gum like a cow eating its curd.

Wait time was 1 hour and 35 minutes .. how perfect is that.

Finally saw the doctor, Johathan Jennings a orthopedic surgeon.   Looked at x-rays for a second then my ankle.  Then he said wow .. looked at x-ray again for an additional 15 seconds and came up with  "possibly a hair line fracture but it is covered with some calcification" so not sure - CROCK.  That just doesn't occur in a short time.  He squeezed here and there and ask if it hurt which it did not.  At that point I think he was stumped.

I asked about a cortisone injection for the inflammation and swelling - nope.  OK, how about taking my NSAID's - yep sure.  I told him I have plenty of Day Pro and could try it again ... he got the deer in the headlights look and finally said he didn't know what it was - so, look it up with that fancy smart phone doc.  I told him what it was and he insisted I needed Meloxican instead.  I have high blood pressure and one of the side effects for that medication is a significant increase in BP and it has a black warning.  The other, you guessed it, swelling in the ankles and feet - ho funny is that!  Apparently he never looked over the 4 pages of paperwork they require us to fill out!  OK I say but I need a written script because I'm headed back to Florida.

I go to check out - no script - surprise, lol.  Back to the girl in the stall to ask for it.  She looks at the computer and tells me it was called in to xyz pharmacy ... 15 minutes later we got that fixed.

I was also supposed to be scheduled for a follow up in 30 days ... no one knew anything about that.  Good thing as it would be a cold day before I'd go back to see this guy or this place.  I'd have to be in real tough shape and desperate.

Definitely NOT RECOMMENDED  I shot better than a half day and $300 for this "service".  This outfit is a meat market.  They schedule 5 patients an hour and the slightest hiccup you're screwed.

name: Christopher Senn
text: Rude! Worry more about $ than helping you. Will refuse to do needed surgery if you owe them money. You might just go to another bone doctor, but they are it in this area.

name: Lisa Brown
text: Can not get through on the phone, I needed to cancel my Appointment, they will not answer 🙃🙃🙃

name: Marinan BREWER
text: They really care!

name: Janet Mclaughlin
text: The Dr I have has been great but I fell messed my cast up and rehurt my foot today my Dr is out and all they recast it didn't check it didn't get to a Dr a wouldn't give me anything for the pain just sent me home hurting with no idea if its hurt worse or not

name: Karen Easterling
text: Dr. Turk and his staff are friendly and very informative. I highly recommend him for any surgery. I asked so many questions about the surgery. They were all answered thoroughly. Everyone was patient and thoughtful.

name: KAREN HOLLINGSHEAD
text:
Dr Turki is terrific!! Straightforward doctoring. Gives a really good shot too😁
The place was busy but so very efficient.
Recommend HIGHLY!!

name: William Reese
text: Dr. Thornbury is thorough, informative, and not an alarmist. He always provides excellent care! I love the way he explains things in a way I can understand and treats my issues in the least invasive manner.

name: Freda Hartley
text: The staff is very nice and professional!!! The Doctors are very informative and knowledgeable as to what the issue that you are dealing with.  I would highly recommend AOS to anyone for their orthopedic needs.

name: Sandee Taylor
text: Dr Turki is very professional and knowledgeable, but also has a great rapport with his patients. I feel very at ease when seeing Dr Turki.

name: Daryn Mccoy
text: The day after surgery I was in therapy,  14 days later I was back at work.  Surgery went great, with little to no pain. Stretching the muscles around the knee and building them up is key to quick recovery.  I'm continuing to exercise my legs to prevent having issues later.

name: Buck Hardy
text: Timely and pleasant staff. Dr Turki was punctual and attentive.  Didn't feel hurried in my appointment.  Answered all my questions and was thorough in helping me understand my issue.

name: Julie Lowery
text: This is the second time I have visited Dr. Turki. From the minute I walked in everyone is so nice. Also, it is amazing how quick they call me to come back to a room. I can barely sit down, before Dr. Turki comes in. He is so very nice and answers all of my questions. I have been to other Orthopedic Offices and the experiences were not like this group. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Matthew
text: Waited over 3 weeks for an appointment. Waited for over 2 hours. I asked reception and there was still atleast 5 other patients ahead of me. I left a little before 5 and they close at 5. Would not recommend.

resp.text: Hello, Matthew. We sincerely regret not meeting your expectations during your recent visit. Patient satisfaction is incredibly important to us and we strive to provide quality, timely care while giving each patient the necessary time they need. We appreciate your feedback and would like the opportunity to discuss your comments further. Please contact us at (334) 274-9000. Thank you.

name: Mark Martin
text: Good Doctors, Dr. Palmer, Dr. Turki  Dr. Davis, Dr. Barrington, The staff is great. All these Doctors have performed surgeries on me over the years. Excellent outcomes. I WOULD RECOMMEND ALABAMA ORTHOPEDIC TO ANYONE.

name: James Cook
text: Staff and Dr Barrington are great. Had both knees replaced within the last year. Would definitely recommend them.

name: Debra Scruggs
text: I have been a patient with AOS for a couple of years. I love the Doctors. I the receptionist for Dr. Davis was very rude, I tried to tell her that I was a new patient for Dr. Davis she told me to only put my name on the sign in paper very rudely.

resp.text: Hello, Debra. Thank you for sharing your experience and for bringing this to our attention. If you're willing, we would like to discuss your comments further. Please call us directly at, (334) 274-9000.

text: I saw Dr. Turki at the Wetumpka location. It was very easy to find on the same strip as Lowe’s. The office is very clean and the staff are efficient. I barely sat down before I was ushered to a waiting room. Dr. Turki came in almost immediately so almost no wait time. We talked about my issue and he recommended a course of treatment. I had a concern about a referral he had given me. He listened to the concern. I am very satisfied with this practice in general.

text: Everyone was so nice, Dr.Davis is great he sent me to some one and now I know why I was hurting, thank you Dr Davis

Thanks Dr. Thornbury for making my foot better.

I have no complaints with the physicians, my family and I have used this group through the years, multiple surgeries, etc. After multiple unreturned phone calls, just to be transferred to the "scheduling" person, who could have gave a care less I have chosen to leave this practice, as well as my family! text: Great staff Great experience with Dr Walcott

name: Gary Myers
text: Professional, thorough and pleasant.

name: lathonya taylor
text: On a Friday I made an appointment, the appointment was scheduled for a Wednesday at 7 AM. Get there Wednesday at  six something  and the reception doesn't see an appointment for me at 7am, but she sees my name in the system,  I have never visited this office, this would've been my first time.  So the reception turns and ask do I want to make appointment,  I told her I did it last Friday for Wednesday at 7 o'clock for my knee. Will not be back again.

name: Karla Smith
text: Appointment was for 9AM, arrived at 8:45AM. I was never called to the window. After sitting for almost an hour, I asked if I needed to complete paperwork because my appointment was for 9:00. The receptionist apologizes and gives me the paperwork.  After about another 45 minutes,  I was called to the back. The nurse apologizes for the wait and tries to explain,  takes my vitals and then....the waiting game. One doctor was relaxing in a chair conversing with another employee. I have no clue where Dr. Davis was. After wasting 3 freaking hours with these unprofessional jerks, I cancelled my appointment,  got my copay refunded and left, never to return. PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME HERE.

name: Yolanda Harriel
text: Overall wonderful

name: June Lockhart
text: Dr Micheal Davis treated me and performed surgery on me. If you are considering using him for your spine, I recommend you find another doctor. Go to UAB or SOS. I was under his care for 22 months. During the time of my care, I told him I was in excruciating pain. I was treated as if I was narcotic searching. I went to 9 doctors trying to get my MRI repeated after Dr Davis refused to repeat the test. Once the MRI was repeated and found results of severe damage to my spine on all levels, I had no choice but to return to Dr Davis because of the “Doctors are God” big boy club of Montgomery. My surgery that was supposed to only be 2 hours long was an 8 hour surgery. My bones were splintered in my lower back. I had told him prior to the surgery that because of a medical issue that he needed to treat me as if I had a bone infection. He did not. Post surgery he lied and said, “ no more MRI’s, the rods placed in your back are real metal not titanium.” *** Real metal rods were pulled from the market in the year 2000. My rods were put in in 2012. Not only that but he wrote my surgical note rather than dictation and the numbers on my rods are not legible. I also had foot drop and had a massive infection post operative. This was not a tiny infection, my temp peaked at 105.1, plus blood loss. There is much more but I have said enough, find another doctor for your own safety.

name: derrick ball
text: Personally I have had multiple visits and the wait time was always very brief (always under 15 minutes). The staff is always courteous and professional. Dr. Hussein Turki was very knowledgeable and attentive. He also took the time to explain all the parameters and patiently listened to and answered any questions I had. I would highly recommend this staff to anyone and everyone.

name: Jeff Naile
text:
Six months out of surgery, four months of physical therapy and I still cannot raise my arm higher than shoulder level without severe pain. Post OP MRI shows, and I quote, " There appears to be a full thickness defect along the anterior supraspinatus at the level of the critical zone/footplate."
Hartzog decides NOT to do any repair and releases me with an impairment rating of 4%.
Yes, you read that right, 4%.
They are more concerned with their relationship with workers comp insurance carriers than the well being of their patients.
I have an appointment with another orthopedic surgeon for a second opinion.
Very disappointed with the level of professionalism at Alabama Orthopedic Specialists.

name: Barb
text:
Dr. Davis staff is rude to patients. Waste of time waiting for hours for no help to resolve back issues. They could at least post a wait time or let people know something. Doctor's should stand by their appointment. I understand when they have an emergency which most nurses will let the customers know so they can choose to wait or reschedule. I will be finding another doctor. I have a job and my time is valuable.

Dr. Thornbury & Barringer have been great to work with & a good staff. Excellent compared to Dr. Davis.

name: Brook Martin
text: My fiancé's appointment was at 10:30AM with Dr. Davis. We signed in at 10:17AM. We were finally called in at 12:00PM. Jessie, the Nurse Practitioner came in at 12:08PM and left soon after. We finally saw Dr. Davis at 12:49PM. He came in and gave us his medical advice which was very unhelpful. I then asked if he would recommend another back doctor for a second opinion, and he refused to recommend anyone other than himself. As we were leaving, he proceeded to record his notes of our visit very loudly. The entire lobby could hear my fiancé's name, birth date, and all of the details of our visit. I will be reporting him for violating HIPAA Privacy laws, and we of course have cancelled all future appointments.

name: Mary Hill
text: This was one of the best experiences I have had at a Drs office. Staff was prompt and friendly. Dr. Davis was very nice,caring and attentive! His nurse and PA was very nice also. I have nothing negative to say!

name: Daniel carrazco
text: My appointment was at 2 o'clock. I was taken back to get x-rays and right after taken to a room. A hour and fifteen mins passes by and I ask one of the attendants if I was going to get seen and she said they were busy but be right with me. 3:40 rolls around and finally I just let them know I would ask my insurance to switch me to a different office and walk out.  Why make my appointment at 2 if the doctor isn't available?! So unprofessional! Almost two hours of waiting in a frigid room to not get seen?! Don't waste your time here. I was supposed to see Dr. Bennett by the way. Supposed to anyways, because I never saw him. Two hours of my life I'll never get back.

name: donna youngblood
text: I was having unbearable pain in my shoulder. I had been to a local ER on a Sunday and had been told to see an orthopedic. Monday was a holiday so I called that hospitals ortho office Tuesday morning. They could not see me until the following Monday. I couldn’t wait that long so I decided to try Andrews Sports Med. They got me into the office the next day.  I saw Dr. Rachel Henderson. She was excellent! They took X-rays and did an MRI that same day. The office called me will the MRI results later that same day! Then the next morning, the outpatient office called me to schedule a nerve block which I had the next day! All this happened within 3 days of calling their office! I have never had to see an orthopedic doc before nor have ever had a nerve block so I was nervous. I can’t say enough about everyone I encountered at the offices. If this happens again I will not be nervous. I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine. I’ll never go anywhere else.

name: William Somar
text: Reputable surgery center but I felt like a number. Visited at the recommendation of my physical therapist for a shoulder issue. When I got to the lobby I could tell this place is set up for mass production: there were check-in kiosks like at the airport and a bunch of people waiting. When I was called the first time, it was to pay. When I was called the second time, I was led to a second  waiting room with no explanation. The third time I was led to an x-ray room where I found out I was getting x-rays. Surprise! Eventually, I was led to an examination room. No vitals were taken. I waited. Eventually, a doctor - not the one I had the appointment with - showed up and immediately started to discuss scheduling surgery without examination. He discussed two procedures - the second one was news to me. When I inquired, he then tested my range of motion to confirm what he had seen in the tests. I expressed doubts about the second procedure and he left to get the originally-scheduled doctor. After nearly 30 minutes, they both came back. The second (scheduled) doctor explained why he recommended the second procedure as a preemptive option. He did a good job of explaining the surgery and recovery. He left and the first doctor took me to a scheduler. Everyone I interacted with was cordial and professional. I never saw my x-rays nor the MRI I had brought with me. I realize this place is good and they have a lot of people to get to. I known they are all fine surgeons. But still, I felt like one more item to check off on their to-do list. I still have unanswered  questions and it is ironic that being there for 2.5 hours and waiting most of the time, that I felt rushed when it came to the consultation. In summary, one of the best places for surgery, but don't expect "the personal touch."

resp.text: Thank you for your candid response. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients. Please feel free to call us at (205) 581-7128 if you would like to discuss.

name: UofAlabamaFan
text: Andrews Sports Medicine has THE BEST DOCTORS.  They are professional, but very personable and approachable.  You never feel like they are in a hurry to see you and get you out of the office.  My family and I have seen four different doctors at Andrews for a variety of problems, and each has had a very successful outcome.  They were surgical, had no problems at all, and are as good as new now.  I have also seen the non-surgical doctors and they are great as well.  They know what they are doing, and do it better than any other doctor.  One family member went to an orthopaedic doctor here in Tuscaloosa several times for a problem with her foot.  He had no idea what was wrong or how to treat her, but he did give her steroid injections a couple of times hoping that would help the problem - it didn't help.  We told her to go to Andrews!  She was able to get a new patient appointment within several days, the doctor saw her, knew exactly what the problem was, performed surgery, and she never had any problems with her foot again.  My family and I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center!

text:
If I could give it a negative star, I would. My wife went to Dr. Henderson for 10 out of 10 pain in her right foot, unable to sleep due to pain and inability to walk on it. After a two hour wait, she was seen, by Dr. Henderson, which was weird because appointments were available all day?  She was condescending, said pain is being caused by a callous on the bottom of her foot and that a pumice stone would take care of it. Then my wife proceeded to take off her other shoe and stated " why isn't the callous hurting this foot." Dr. then said, well, maybe it is a bunion. No X-ray, no nothing.

Fast forward two days later, we are getting an X-ray and getting a second opinion. Come to find out it is a severe impact injury with bone growth (Spur) and needs surgery to remove. Dr. we obtained a second opinion from stated he makes his living off of people coming to him from Andrews with misdiagnosis or lack of adequate care.

name: John Pointon
text: I chose Andrews for total hip replacement a year ago after research online and personal recommendations from prior patients. I couldn't be more satisfied. Yes, they're busy - not surprising considering their reputation - but they are much more efficient than most medical practices struggling with all the usual issues: insurance; billing; scheduling; non-user friendly EMR systems; HIPAA; etc. etc. All aspects of the process - scheduling, pre-op briefing, surgery and post-op care were first rate. The surgeon took time to explain pros/cons and expectations clearly, and answer questions. Back on my feet in no time. Follow up during the year has been excellent and the procedure was transformative. Recently hiked extensive distances over rough, hilly terrain with no discomfort - fantastic!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your trust in our practice. In addition, thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Trish Martin
text: I have been a patient with Andrew's Sports Medicine for several years through two surgeries and have always received excellent patient care.

Their staff was great!  Both procedures exceeded my expectations on recovery and return to full use.  Would definitely recommend both of these surgeons.  Also seeing Dr. McKeon for a deteriorated thumb joint.  She and her staff have been great to work with on this long term issue.

text: Be careful and do your research first.  We thought we would receive world class orthopedic care close to home. We cannot advocate for this place due to our own experience, though I am sure there is variance between the surgeons skill and degree to which they actually care for patients.

name: Todd Cruse
text: If I could give this place less than one star I would. First I want to say that Dr. Emblom is great all around and I have heard the same things about most of their surgeons. However, everything else about this place is absolutely terrible. They treat their patients like second class and never really seemed concerned at all with what is going on with you. I've never waited in the lobby less than two hours and then expect another hour when they finally do get you in a room. If you have any other option, choose the other option.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue, Todd. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met in your interaction with us.

Please feel free to call (205) 581-7128 if you'd like to discuss your personal experience.

name: Tom Jenkyn
text:
As a disabled vet, I've had more than my fair share of orthopedic problems and surgeries. I had the good fortune to have Dr Steven R. Nichols perform multiple surgeries on my spine. Yes, they were different problems at different locations. He was recommended to me by friends in Sports Medicine at the University where I worked.

The first was a neck fusion, about 10 years ago. I was without pain, discharged, and went home the same day. Ten days after surgery I drove non-stop from Meridian, Mississippi to San Antonio, Texas. Last July he performed Lumbar Laminectomy surgery and removed the debris and spurs that were causing numbness in both legs and prohibited me from standing up straight. Again, discharged the same day, feeling returned to both legs and walking as the Good Lord intended.  There is not another Doctor on the planet I would allow to cut on my spine than Dr. Nichols.

His professionalism exemplifies what Andrews Sports Medicine stands for.  My family and I were always given  the same care and concern as the professional athletes they have become famous for treating. Simple logic dictates that if world class professional athletes with unlimited resources, who depend on their bodies performing at the level they do, seek out his services, it must be top notch. I have recommended him to friends and will continue to do so. If I didn't recommend him, it would be as though I didn't care about people who are an important part of my life.

name: Amy Armstrong
text: Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics Center is a very busy place but it is run like a well oiled machine. I’ve never had to sit in the waiting room more than a few short minutes. Several friends recommended Dr. Sam Goldstein to me and I wasn’t disappointed.  Dr. Goldstein listened to me patiently, had my MRI done on the spot and gave me results that same day. My injury is still healing but I’m getting there.

resp.text: Amy, thanks so much for the 5-star rating and for the kind words about Dr. Sam Goldstein.

text: I had the best experience anyone have with Dr. Cordover and Dr. McKeon. I originally went  in for my neck pinched nerve in neck. Dr. Cordover was on a mission.
