He noticed that I had atrophy in my hand and immediately contacted Dr. McKeon and they tag teamed me. I required surgery on my arm due to the muscle atrophy. Dr. Cordover wanted to wait and try a nerve block for my neck first. Long story short Dr. Cordover did neck surgery and I feel like a new man. Thanks to Dr. Cordover for giving me back my life. Superb staff and facilities. Will not use any one else. If I have to rate my experience on a 5 star scale I would give them twenty.

name: Brookelynne Mathews
text:
My husband had major foot /ankle surgery with Dr.Waldrop. He had all tendons repaired, his heel was moved over, the archilles tendon cut and lengthened!  It has been Over a year of being off work and unable to walk/stand or wear steel toe boots tk return to work . No matter how much we told this man that my husband IS in pain he did NOTHING except a few x-rays that NEVER show anything. It took an MRI and nerve test in the beginning BEFORE surgery to even find the problem. Not once did Dr. Waldrop order a MRI or nerve test!!  We had to insist on a referral to see a Pain management doctor because after two months he felt my husband didn't need pain meds.
The only thing  Dr. Waldrop would say is "Umm, I see". Never did any test after surgery except an X-ray, and we believe that's because he knows my husbands foot is worse after his surgery.
My husbands long term disability with his company has now been stopped due to Dr. Waldrops opinion that he can return to work WHEN HE CANNOT!!!
If you use this man make sure you get in writing from him BEFORE leaving his office if you can't return to work. !!

text: Ridiculously long wait time. There are several more doctors as good as these that won't make people wait so long

resp.text:
Cameron, we apologize for the long wait and inconvenience. We do our best to let all patients know to allow a minimum of two hours for their visit.

We are a high-volume practice. Our physicians are committed to spending adequate time with every patient to listen to their situation, properly diagnose their condition, discuss recommended forms of treatment, and address any additional questions and/or concerns they may have. Unfortunately, this sometimes results in long wait times.

name: Lita Peer
text: Dr. Dugas and his staff are hands down the best in the practice especially in the area. Possibly even the best in the world. Dr. Dugas has been my surgeon for 15 years! Over those 15 years we did 5 or 6 surgeries on my right leg, a couple of minor ones with one HUGE one at age 15. That one included breaking my leg to realign bones correctly and screws/plates to keep me together until it was time to remove them (which was almost 10 years later and in the middle of my career) but now I’m able to stand on my feet all day and do hair and makeup, which wouldn’t have been impossible without this fabulous staff including their PT program at Champion Sports Medicine! Dr. Dugas is the most respectful, honest, caring, understanding, comforting doctor I could ever imagine having. If I moved out of state and something with my leg needed to be looked at, I’d always travel back to them without hesitation! Thanks to everyone in that building for being amazing! 5 stars isn’t enough!

text: We traveled to Birmingham from Maryland to see Dr. Dugas.  Our 17 year old son has a proximal tear to his ulnar collateral ligament. He understands not only the physical challenges of the surgery, he understands the mental and emotional journey.    Dr. Dugas will forever hold a special place in our hearts.  Great doctor, great man and we will/would recommend him in a heartbeat!

name: Shawna Tatarchuk
text:
I have been suffering with plantar fasciitis for five years. Being an active person who likes to hike and lives on a farm, I immediately went to the doctor and was referred for physical therapy. It didn't help at all. Over the last five years, I have tried different doctors who have referred me to different physical therapists, with no change in pain level.
At my last doctor's appointment, my primary doctor asked if anything was bothering me and I told him I still had plantar fasciitis. We talked through my experience and he suggested I try a different podiatrist, Dr. Stark. Dr. Stark immediately referred me to Therapy South and asked that I see Robert Harris. I went to the appointment not expecting any different outcome but I am so glad I went! Robert was encouraging, saying he had a plan and he felt confident he could help me. We started with therapy three times a week, addressing first the plantar problem but then working backward to involve the parts of the leg and hip that caused the injury in the first place. Robert gave me four exercises to do twice daily at home and I logged exercise sessions through an easy to use app. Each appointment has been a teaching experience. Robert asks how I'm doing, I tell him how I'm progressing or having problems and he immediately explains and teaches me a stretch or exercise that will help. Robert's goal is to teach me strategies to address problems independently in the future. Each week finds me feeling better, my plantar fasciitis pain now almost completely gone. I am truly thankful to Therapy South!
I recommend Therapy South and Robert Harris for anyone needing physical therapy. They are knowledgeable and extremely professional!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Casey R
text:
I came to TherapySouth in 2015 with extreme pain and muscle spasms in my neck and arm due to a cervical disk herniation. The injury happened around 1 year before I became their patient.  During that year, I had no luck controlling the pain with pharmacological therapy, cervical steroid epidurals or a previous round of physical therapy. I found myself in bed and in tears almost daily due to the pain the pain I felt. It affected my schoolwork, my social life, and my ability to do general everyday activities like driving etc.

I was very apprehensive about physical therapy when it was prescribed to me for a second time. The first time around (at a different facility in the Auburn area) physical therapy left me feeling defeated and in more pain than ever. However, after my very FIRST visit with Robert, I knew that TherapySouth was the place to be. He took his time to get every detail about my pain level, mobility, daily activities and most importantly, my end goals for therapy.

He created a workout and therapy plan tailored to my specific needs and abilities.  After every session I felt increasingly better. Nine months later, I am able to do most activities that I want/need/love to do without ANY pain and I have gained muscle strength and flexibility that I so desperately needed.

I really don't know what I would have done without the physical therapists Robert and Emily, their interns, and the wonderful staff at TherapySouth-Auburn. They are all amazing, caring and thoughtful individuals and their skills and knowledge are exemplar. I am so thankful to have been under their care.

name: Tristan Hughes
text: Absolutely great. They are aware of the science and the office is full of energy, but it's not in your face. This is the third and best PT I've been to. Everyone is kind and very good at their job.

resp.text: Thank you!  TherapySouth Auburn strives to offer the highest quality physical therapy care in our area!

name: Charlie Crawford
text:
Over a lifetime of injuries, from motorcycle accidents to on-the-job, to athletic, I have been prescribed physical therapy many times.   A year and a half ago, I could no longer live with my shoulder pain, both sides due to torn rotator cuffs.  My orthopedist said surgery was likely the only way to successfully heal.  I did not want that and asked for a PT referral.  I began therapy at TherapySouth in January 2018 and was surprised at how thorough and caring the folks were.  I was asked detailed questions throughout my initial evaluation and follow-up questions during each exercise.  Robert and Dreher would adjust exercises according to my limits and evaluate my ongoing recovery at each session.  By April, I had almost full motion in my arms/shoulders, pain was gone, and I even could reach around back to scratch my shoulder blades!  All without any NSAIDS or other drugs.

So when I began having elbow pain this year, I asked my doctor for a referral to TherapySouth.  Once again a thorough evaluation of my pain and its source was done by Robert.  By the second session I was already experiencing significant relief from pain that was serious enough to keep me awake at night.  And no drugs!  During my last session, I menbtioned that I also suffered from occipital neuralgia.  Robert did not seem surprised and showed me how complex the relationship with all the tendons, muscles, etc in the back and neck can end up causing pain and trigger points.  Here I am two days later with reduced pain throughout my neck, back, shoulders.

If you are injured, TherapySouth is the place to go for Physical Therapy.  I've literally been to dozens of therapists over a lifetime.  No one comes close to these folks.  If I could give them 10 stars instead of 5 I would do that.  I'm lucky to have found them and grateful for all they have done for me.  I would never go elsewhere.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Angela Fells
text: Know one wants to go to therapy.  However, if you do you want to be treated by people who care. I have been coming here for a while now. I have been seen by every therapist that works here. I am pleased to say, THEY ALL ROCK!!  Even though Dreher can’t sing he makes my day all three days that I come. If you need therapy, Sarah, Robert, and Dreher are all good choices. Very professional and caring group.  Could not ask for a better experience.
]Really helped with my problem. I thank and appreciate them all.

name: Warren Smith
text:
I was referred for physical therapy after cervical stenosis corrective surgery (ACDF).  In layperson terms, I needed help to retrain my muscles to function normally after years of unconscious tension and stiffness around my area of pain in my neck.

I was blessed to find my way to Therapy South in Auburn where the staff of PT experts assessed my condition, then developed a plan to get me back to normal, pain free movement and function. The lead Therapy South professionals are DPTs  (Doctor of Physical Therapy).   These professionals impressed me every visit with their deep knowledge of the human body and how to help it recover from injury or surgery.

When I first came to Therapy South, I had neck tightness and pain, leg weakness and very poor balance.  After just a few weeks, the staff at Therapy South helped me with treatments and exercises that completely removed the pain, dramatically reduced the stiffness, and helped me make huge progress in returning to normal balance.  I feel so much better about my physical health today because the team at Therapy South delivered effective care and treatment.  They have the expertise, the facilities and the patient first mentality to make a big difference in therapy for improvement in quality of life use of the body.  Without reservation, I recommend Therapy South to anyone in need of help to recover lost or limited physical movement, or relief from pain.

text: Excellent experience dealing with his office and staff. Made me at ease for my shoulder surgery. Surgery was a success and I was back up and going full speed in 6 weeks. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Mr. Graham, thank you for trusting in me as your surgeon and for the 5-star rating.

name: Charlcie Vann
text: Dr. McGough is an EXCELLENT surgeon!  He and his staff performed my Total Hip replacement over a year ago.  Selecting Dr. M as my doctor was one of the best decision I could have made.  Dr. M. YOU ROCK!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Charlcie. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,

Dr. B. Wayne McGough, Jr, M.D. - Birmingham, AL

name: Julie Clark
text: Good bedside manner. Listen to my worries and answered my questions. Took on what was an impossible surgery and made it look like a piece of cake. This was my third surgery on my shoulder. So thankful for Dr. McGough and his amazing skill at surgery. Thanks Dr. McGough.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Deb Montgomery
text: Dr. McGough was excellent with my Mom.  He gave her an injection and was very personable and caring.

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

name: Perry Nye
text: I'm seeing Dr. McGough about my knee. I broke my knee cap. I really appreciated his conservative approach to treating my knee. He didn't rush to surgery and chose to see if it would heal on it's on. He was correct and it did. I had already been looking at having it replaced due to an old injury. We discussed my options and when I am ready I will definitely use Dr. McGough.

name: Lisa Miller
text: I highly recommend Dr. McGough!  I have had three surgeries with Dr. McGough which include two knee replacements and a torn rotator cuff and they were all highly successful.   He is very caring and an excellent surgeon.

resp.text: Lisa, thank you for trusting in me as your surgeon and for the 5-star rating.

name: Betty Kelley
text: Dr McGough is a wonderful Doctor, he shows he is interested in his patients, he doesn't rush in and out,he takes time with you and listens to your concerns. I would and have recommended him to othets

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Bill Palmer
text:
I have been an avid hiker most of my life.  Suddenly, one day last May, my knee became so painful I could not walk.  Arthritis, due to an old injury from 40 years ago.  I met with Dr McGough at Andrews after checking out their website.  I liked the whole robotic-assist surgery idea.   He seemed very interested in what was going on in my leg from previous trama and listened intently.   He also was very good about answering any questions and walking me through what to expect.
It's only been two weeks since total knee replacement surgery,  but I am getting around well and the pain from surgery is now minimal.  It seems Dr McGough did a great job!    He seems to really care about helping his patients.  I am glad I got this done now, instead of waiting and I look forward to being able to hike again real soon.  I would definitely recommend Dr McGough to anyone with knee problems.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Amari Bradley
text: I was out of town visiting my boyfriend, and I thought I sprained a ligament in my knee. I went to a local urgent care center and received a referral to the Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center. Initially, my appointment was with Dr. Colberg, but I was quickly sent to Dr. McGough. After meeting with Dr. McGough and getting an MRI, I was informed that I had a bucket handle tear in my meniscus. From my first appointment I felt at ease. I’ve never had any major surgery (other than wisdom tooth extraction), so needless to say I was NERVOUS. Dr. McGough and his staff took excellent care of me. I’m super happy that I’m no longer wearing a brace and having to go to weekly physical therapy sessions. Thank you all for everything!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Gloria Hood
text:
Everyone at Andrews is so wonderful and caring.  And without a doubt,
Dr. McGough is one of the most caring physicians, as well being a "personal"  person, that I have ever had the pleasure of going to.
He always has time to listen, care, share and he wants to do what the patient feels is best for them.  He's always willing to try a remedy as opposed to suggesting surgery as the quick and easy means to an end.
When/ if he ever tells me I need surgery, I will know definitively that I really need it and it's the only alternative to making me truly better.

Thank you Dr. McGough and staff for your love.

GiGi Hood

name: Gregory Slappey
text: Dr. McGough did a fantastic job of minimizing the pain while injecting steroids into my knee to relieve pain. He did a good job explaining the problems with my knee. Though the injections really did not help for very long at all I will return to him to discuss knee replacement after I recover from brain surgery.

name: Daisy Blue05
text: Should not have gone through so much pain after a knee revision surgery by Dr. F. After the surgery I did physical therapy and still in pain. Returned to Dr F who just assumed  I had a back problem without him even taking a X-ray. For 7 months he sent me to get injections in my spine. I was still in pain and referred to a back surgeon and what he found was a deteriorated right hip. Once again Dr. F sent me to get injections in my hip. I got an injection in my hip but I will get second opinions with another surgeon on all that Dr. F’s unprofessionally surgery he did and putting me through what he did and assuming I had back problems without an X-ray. I’m sure Dr. F wouldn’t appreciate his family going through what he put me through which could have all been avoided if he would have taken one X-ray. He needs to learn that he can’t see through a person to diagnose their problems. I won’t return here ever again or be put through pain for 7 months for his neglect of a surgeon who only wanted his money. After 7 months he did not know who I was which showed me that he is a money hungry surgeon only. Young surgeon who needs to get his facts straight and stop assuming what’s wrong. A surgeon who didn’t know who I was?  He finally did an X-ray but took 7 months for him to do it. I’ve had enough and never again. Take my advice and find you another surgeon besides Farris you will regret it if you do. I have 3 witnesses to back me up , another surgeon and a injection specialist who also asked me where my back X-ray was, there wasn’t one.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not meet your expectations during your time in our clinic. To discuss your experience further, please email pr@southernbone.com. Thank you.

name: Richard Taylor
text: Not military friendly at all.  My daughter had an appointment here while we were in a PCS status, and because of this and technical difficulties with Tricare, the insurance claim wasn't paid immediately.  We were able to resolve the paperwork once we got to our new duty station, but SBAJS had already passed it to a collections agency and refused to recall it.

resp.text: Mr. Taylor - we apologize that you had trouble in regards to the insurance/billing process. If you are still needing assistance, please feel free to email pr@southernbone.com and someone from our office will contact you.

name: Eternal Underscore
text: No one answers during business hours and on call service can't take messages regarding appointments.

resp.text: I'm sorry that we have been unable to connect with you. If you would please email pr@southernbone.com with your name and best contact number, someone from our office will call you. Thank you!

name: Daniel Jowers
text:
I saw Dr Lett with a bad hip pain I was had been having for several months. It was determined after X Ray's I needed a Left Hip replacement. It was scheduled to be done November 18th. I was released the next day and I have to say I had wished I done it a long time ago 3 days later I'm walking without a walker. Dr. Lett and his entire staff were amazing.
Daniel Jowers

resp.text: Mr. Jowers - thank you so much for taking the time to rate us and share your story. We are so glad to hear you are doing well!

name: Eryka Kenschaft
text: I have extensive injuries from a car accident and was recieving treatment in PA. I went to get a follow up examination because I’m temporarily here in Enterprise Alabama getting help from my mom until I am fully healed. Dr Lett came in the exam room  for 4-5 min and didn’t ask me anything about how I was actually doing but wrote an evaluation stating false information that he never even asked me. He offered no physical therapy and insisted since I am young I will be fine. I want to get better and need professional medical help yet he failed to provide this. I honestly don’t know what to do..

resp.text: Ms. Kenschaft - we apologize that your expectations were not met during your office visit. If you wish to discuss your feedback further, please email pr@southernbone.com and provide a phone number that you may be reached.

name: Lawrence Castagneto
text: myself and wife have had numerous surgeries, there by Dr Lett  he  is fantastic and professional we live in Webb Al  but go to enterprise for our needs with Dr Lett......He has always  done us right for the last 20 yrs as has the entire office and staff .....I can,t say the same for the Dothan  Ross Clark office

resp.text: Mr. Castagneto - thanks so much for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are glad to hear of your satisfaction with Dr. Lett and our Enterprise team! I'm sorry that your visit(s) with any other location did not leave the same impression. If you have suggestions for improvement, please email pr@southernbone.com and let us know. Thank you!

name: Amanda Pease
text: My son broke his elbow 2 years ago and we saw doctor Farris. The experience was friendly and nice. Doctor Farris went through the whole 6wks process with me and my son. The only thing is I forgot to ask doctor Farris for a picture of the x-ray of my son's broken elbow. He wanted a picture, did not want the cast.

name: Jena Hughes
text:
I actually injured myself on 6/15 and I could not be seen during office hours. I went to an urgent care and had X-rays and was told to follow up with Orthopedic Dr to go from here. Which would be no different had I went to the ER in Enterprise.
I touched base on Friday when I woke up and the telephone receptionist was so very rude. It was suggested to give it the weekend and call back on Monday.
I called Monday 6/19 and was still swelling, hurting and very upset because I knew driving was also going to come into play. I stuck only with ibuprofen instead of pain medication. As soon as I woke up I called around 8:45AM.  Of course, I explained the story again, passed on my insurance information, and updated my personal information. The young lady on the phone was rude and very short. She then told me that she would speak to the Dr and get back with me. I got dressed and was ready to go as soon as she told me. My Mom was here to make sure I had help etc.  I also called the Irgent care place and requested a disc of my X-rays to pick up. My phone rang again around 11:30 and am was asked if I could contact the urgent care place and have the radiology report sent to SB&J. I did and she said that once the Dr had that info she would call me back and try to get me in after talking to the Dr. Again, we sat and waited for hours. At around 3:20 I received a phone call informing me that the Dr wanted me to wait until Wednesday and continue what I was doing. I stressed again the pain, how unstable I was feeling and the problems with being on crutches. She placed me on hold and came back again and rudely said "call back on Wednesday".
So, I wasted mine and my Mother's Day trying to get appropriate help. It was now 3:40 in the afternoon.
I woke up this morning 6/21 and called first thing this morning, around 8:30AM only to reach a different and terrible personality on the phone. I explained the entire situation again.  She said that she would talk to the Dr and give me a call back. Of course, my Mother was here once again to help me. At around 11:40AM I received a call and an appointment was schedule for 6/22. I explained the pain, how long I had been put off and again was not her problem and you could tell she didn't care. I said, "there is no way I can be seen today?"  Her response, "The Dr is trying to leave early today and there is nothing else I can do!"  I explained that I would be calling around to get into a different branch or somewhere else. She didn't care about me and neither did that Dr apparently. I was angry and emotionally upset. I felt like this practice had no reason to be in business.
I contacted a different office and guess what. It was 11:50AM and I had an appointment at 1:50PM. The Dr I saw was awesome and nobody seemed to be surprised by my story. Also, all the information that I had given to the rude ladies was not passed along. I had to go by and pick up a disc and a copy of the report to take with me. I now have the appropriate diagnosis, I am not in pain, the correct stability, an exercise strategy and feel 💯% better. I did not want to cancel the appointment that was scheduled with the other office out of anger but I also did not want to be charged for a no show. I called back and a different rude lady answered the phone and I asked to speak to the girl i spoke with earlier. (Yes, I have the Dr's name and two of the girls I spoke with names however, I will keep them off the review. I told her I needed to cancel the appointment and she said, "fine and hung up". So if you want to be treated like you are human or that you are actually cared about this Customer Service and Orthopedic office is NOT the place you want to be.
In all honesty they are the only ones here in Enterprise and they must think we need them however, truth be told they need us. Without patients there is no practice. I would love nothing more than to see this business disappear and fail.
Horrible way to treat people especially when I did everything I was asked to do. 😡

name: DD
text: Great place. Great staff. Great Doctor’s.

name: Raven Red
text:
1 STAR for office/receptionist/phone girl..
4 STAR for Dr. Brooks and Dr. Lett

i have seen both Dr. Lett and Dr. Brooks, both are knowledgeable and i had no problems with either.  Brooks is straight forward, professional and not as friendly where Lett is very friendly.....They both have an abundance of knowledge though...which, at the end of the day is most important.  If i was rating this office for customer service and friendliness of staff (the ones that answer the phone at front desk and check out girl at window) they would receive a ONE STAR.  EVERY time i've called or been there, those girls are rude...be it over the phone or in person.  Terribly rude and I would think this establishment would lose business due to the lack of  Customer Service here...nurses were great..receptionisdt/office girls not well trained at all.
